programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: The 'edible' glitter that no one would want to eat, the people posing as bailiffs to threaten small businesses and the fake breathalysers that could cost drivers their licence.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer - Title 1
Homes Under the Hammer - Title 2
Homes Under the Hammer - Title 3
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin explore a semi in Chingford, London, a one-bedroom flat in Brighton and a Victorian terrace in Normanton, Derby.

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed - Title 1
Oxford Street Revealed - Title 2
Oxford Street Revealed - Title 3
programme.desc: Undercover police set out to catch shoplifters red-handed, the John Lewis staff celebrate Burns Night and the Dominion Theatre gets ready for the opening of The Lord of the Dance.

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville unravel the conflicting advice people are given about the benefits and dangers of everyday foods.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Claire Rawle and Paul Laidlaw help two teams search an antiques fair in Leominster, Herefordshire, for items to take to auction, where they aim to make a profit. Plus, Tim Wonnacott visits the former home of Charles Darwin and discovers how the naturalist's family is connected to the Wedgwoods.

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Ruhma uncovers an unlikely connection between two first-time mums. Rob has his eye on Al, while Mrs Tembe is determined to take a stand. Medical drama, starring Bharti Patel, Chris Walker and Lorna Laidlaw.

credits.actor: Dr Jimmi Clay - Adrian Lewis Morgan

programme.title: The Coroner
programme.desc: The owner of an ice-cream factory is found dead in a walk-in freezer, and while Davey pursues the man's son as prime suspect, Jane finds evidence to suggests his wife is to blame.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a couple of keen walkers with a budget of £500,000 locate the perfect rural property in North Yorkshire. She also meets a jet jeweller in Whitby and discovers the natural gem's historic links with the county.

programme.title: Len and Ainsley's Big Food Adventure
programme.desc: Len Goodman and Ainsley Harriott reach Cardiff, where the Strictly judge has his first taste of spaghetti and samples some German hospitality, and Ainsley cooks an Italian dish.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Charlie Ross and Will Axon assess items at Ragley Hall in Warwickshire, including a Busby hat and a Worcester coffee set. Presenter Paul Martin explores the Battle of Edgehill.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Alex Jones present the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest.

programme.title: Watchdog
programme.desc: Sophie Raworth, Matt Allwright, Chris Hollins and Michelle Ackerley present the consumer show, including an undercover investigation into the company taking money out of customers' accounts without asking. Actress Sheila Hancock looks into rising insurance premiums and Rogue Traders features a car dealer caught lying to his customers on camera.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: A fuming Sharon enlists Billy and Jay's help in getting an inebriated Phil home - but as his need for another drink grows, she snaps and ends up locking him in the bedroom. Aunt Sal warns Claudette that she knows her secret, and Denise bumps into the police officer who came to her house and learns who gave her the address. Roxy wonders if she's made the right decision about Dean.

programme.title: Doctor in the House
programme.desc: Dr Rangan Chatterjee is invited to move in with another family to give its members a health MOT. He starts by looking into husband Ray's back pain, from which he has suffered for decades, despite looking fit and running his own gym. He also investigates the cause of Ray's five-year-old son's eczema, and draws up a plan of lifestyle changes to improve the family's general state of health. At the end of his intervention, Ray, his partner Rachel and son Lucas are tested to measure just how much of an impact the resident medic has had.

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby chairs the debate from the Manchester district of Wythenshawe, with a panel of politicians and celebrity guests facing topical questions from the audience.

programme.title: This Week
programme.desc: Andrew Neil presents round-table chat, in which he and his guests take a light-hearted romp through the political and parliamentary developments of the past seven days. They'll be discussing who is making the headlines and the issues that matter to both MPs and the public.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: The fake chairs that put child safety at risk, counterfeit carbon monoxide detectors that could cost lives, and one of the most sophisticated £2 coins ever seen.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a bungalow in Surrey, a one-bedroom flat in Gateshead, Tyne and Wear, and an Edwardian water tower in Maidstone, Kent, which is to be transformed into a home. They then meet the new owners to discuss their plans for the properties, and discover how much they paid for them at auction.

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed
programme.desc: An undercover police team tries to put a stop to a cup-and-ball gaming scam that is taking visitors to the thoroughfare for a ride. Plus, cameras monitor events as a new Underground station is opened at the east end of the Street and an Olympic champion arrives for a bike race with a difference.

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville reveal unmissable secrets about the freshness of some of the nation's foods.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two teams compete in Builth Wells, mid-Wales, scouring an antiques fair to pick up bargains to sell for profit at auction, and calling on the expertise of Ben Cooper and Philip Serrell to guide them. Meanwhile, presenter Tim Wonnacott pays a visit to Ironbridge in Shropshire.

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Ayesha treats a patient who has just won the lottery but cannot find the ticket, and Valerie is nervous ahead of receiving her test results.

credits.actor: Dr Jimmi Clay - Adrian Lewis Morgan

programme.title: The Coroner
programme.desc: A woman dies in the build-up to a Latin dance festival in Lighthaven, but the body mysteriously vanishes from the mortuary as Jane and Davey argue over what they think happened. Last in the series.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman tries to help a couple hoping to swap London life for a village community in Dorset, and learns about the Lulworth Estate rangers' conservation efforts.

programme.title: Len and Ainsley's Big Food Adventure
programme.desc: Chef Ainsley Harriott and Strictly Come Dancing judge Len Goodman's road trip takes the pair to south London, where Len has his first taste of Portuguese and Japanese cuisine. Ainsley heads to the kitchen and cooks a mouth-watering Portuguese chicken inspired by the day's adventures. Last in the series.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: The team visits De Montfort Hall, Leicestershire, where experts Catherine Southon and Claire Rawle scour the displays for the best goods to take to auction. Meanwhile, presenter Paul Martin finds out how BBC local radio was born in Leicester.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Andy Hamilton joins Patrick Kielty and Angellica Bell on sofa, while Joe Crowley makes potato vodka and Carrie Grant finds out the real story behind Reef's song Place Your Hands.

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Wales rugby union captain Scott Quinnell, West Indies fast bowler Tino Best, England netballer Tamsin Greenway and ex-Scotland striker Kevin Gallacher join Matt Dawson and Phil Tufnell on the light-hearted sports quiz, hosted by Sue Barker.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: A broken Sharon still refuses to let Phil out of the bedroom, but he is determined to have a drink. The ensuing argument leads to violence - can their marriage survive? It's the day of Linda's hen party, although the guest of honour is disappointed when Sharon makes an excuse not to go. Vincent confronts Arthur over the missing item from the safe, Denise opens up to Carmel, and Lee offers help to Cora - but will she accept it? Shabnam and Kush return from honeymoon and head to the Vic, where they see Stacey.

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Mr Khan opens a fried chicken shop, having kept it secret from Mrs Khan, who invites him along to watch her tango class demonstration after deciding she and her husband need to have more 'together time'. Matters become more complicated when the shop manager (guest star Ronni Ancona) takes a shine to Amjad. Comedy, with Adil Ray.

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Jo Brand hosts the satirical current affairs quiz, joined by team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop, with comedian Josh Widdicombe and Leader of the Liberal Democrats Tim Farron on the panel.

programme.title: Peter Kay's Car Share
programme.desc: Peter Kay stars in this sitcom about the daily commute of two supermarket employees thrown together in a company car-share scheme, with each daily trip bringing fresh insight into their lives. But will they actually get along? Things don't get off to a good start for assistant manager John when his sat-nav leads him a merry dance as he tries to find promotions rep Kayleigh's house - and when she does finally get in the car, it doesn't take long for her to mark her territory. Sian Gibson co-stars.

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Hollywood icon Johnny Depp graces Graham's sofa, alongside Sherlock actor Benedict Cumberbatch, Depp's co-star in the new mobster movie Black Mass. Daniel Radcliffe is taking another important step to brushing away his Harry Potter association in the upcoming film Victor Frankenstein, and he and co-star James McAvoy also share a natter with the host. Plus, music from recently reformed Irish group the Corrs and Graham challenges more audience members to regale him with anecdotes from the dreaded red chair.

programme.title: Josh
programme.desc: Owen and Josh have time to kill ahead of a night watching darts, but cannot afford to get drunk, so they attend Owen's cousin's wedding in the hope of there being a free bar. Meanwhile, Kate struggles to entertain herself in her flat while waiting for her new phone to be delivered.

programme.title: A Few Best Men
programme.desc: An Englishman falls in love with a woman he meets on holiday in Australia, and asks her to marry him. However, he then makes the mistake of bringing three friends over to be his best men, only for the mayhem they cause to nearly destroy his marriage before it has begun. Comedy, starring Xavier Samuel, Laura Brent, Kris Marshall and Olivia Newton-John.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: DJ, broadcaster and incoming Top Gear host Chris Evans faces food heaven or hell as James Martin invites Jason Atherton and Russell Norman to prepare dishes in the studio.

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Dan Walker and guests look ahead to the weekend's fixtures, which include Tottenham Hotspur v Chelsea and Leicester City v Manchester United.

programme.title: Live Formula 1
programme.sub-title: Formula 1: Abu Dhabi Grand Prix - Qualifying: 2015
programme.desc: Suzi Perry presents coverage of the battle for pole position in the 19th and final round of the season from Yas Marina Circuit (Start-time 1.00pm). All eyes will be on Mercedes drivers Nico Rosberg and Lewis Hamilton, who have dominated qualifying for the majority of the last two seasons, and are likely to be ahead of the rest of the field once again.

programme.title: Live Davis Cup Tennis
programme.sub-title: Tennis: Davis Cup Final: Belgium v Great Britain: Day Two
programme.desc: Belgium v Great Britain. Coverage of day two of the World Group's showpiece match, featuring the doubles rubber at Flanders Expo in Ghent. Brothers Andy and Jamie Murray have teamed up for the doubles match in the two previous rounds, and recorded a four-set victory over Nicolas Mahut and Jo-Wilfried Tsonga of France in the quarter-finals, but needed all five sets before eventually prevailing over Australia's Sam Groth and Lleyton Hewitt in the semi-finals. Presented by Sue Barker, with commentary by Jonathan Overend, John Lloyd and Jamie Baker.

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: Children's TV star Johnny Ball, radio DJ Mary Anne Hobbs, actor Neil Fitzmaurice (Peep Show's Jeff) and CBBC presenter Katie Thistleton answer questions on the life and work of scientist Michael Faraday, motorcycle road racer Barry Sheene, the films of Robert De Niro and the life and times of character Rachel Green from the sitcom Friends. John Humphrys asks the questions.

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a Formula One-themed edition of the general knowledge quiz, challenging stars associated with the sport to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public. The competitors are retired F1 racer David Coulthard and Australian motorsports star Mark Webber, former driver Allan McNish and Williams F1 deputy team principal Claire Williams, veteran commentator Murray Walker and ex-champion Nigel Mansell, and Red Bull Principal Christian Horner and ex-MotoGP presenter Suzi Perry.

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing
programme.desc: Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman present as the pro-celebrity dancing contest returns home to the studio following the trip away to Blackpool's Tower Ballroom. While Kellie Bright, Peter Andre, Georgia May Foote, Helen George, Katie Derham, Anita Rani and Jay McGuiness may have come back to more familiar surroundings, there's no less glamour on offer, as Len Goodman, Darcey Bussell, Bruno Tonioli and Craig Revel Horwood appraise their performances in Ballroom and Latin routines. The stars are also given a chance to improve their initial scores in a Quickstepathon. Once all the competitors have had a second chance to dance, the viewing public will decide which two pairs will face each other in tomorrow's dance-off, which as ever will see one unlucky duo leave the contest.

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: The Doctor faces the greatest challenge of his many lives when he is trapped, alone, in a world unlike any he has ever seen. Pursued by a fearsome creature known only as 'the Veil', the Time Lord must attempt the impossible in one final test, and if he makes it through, the long-lost world of Gallifrey is waiting. Peter Capaldi takes centre-stage in what is effectively a one-man episode for the first half of this year's series finale.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Cal refuses to believe that Matilda is not his daughter, and decides to contest the outcome of the paternity test by discovering his blood group. However, when the results come back in, he makes a far more shocking discovery that leaves him shaken and bereft of any sense of identity. Meanwhile, Jacob impresses Connie by keeping his anger under control while dealing with an uncooperative patient, and an encounter in the staff room causes the sexual tension between the pair to grow. Medical drama, starring Richard Winsor, George Rainsford, Charles Venn and Amanda Mealing.

programme.title: The National Lottery Live
programme.desc: Special guest Jason Donovan performs live, and does the honour of pushing the button as host Ore Oduba reveals the all-important winning numbers.

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker introduces highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Manchester City v Southampton at the Etihad Stadium and Leicester City v Manchester United at the King Power Stadium. The Saints have been in fine form lately following a stuttering start to the season, while Leicester were aiming to continue their outstanding campaign against their illustrious visitors. Plus, Aston Villa v Watford, Bournemouth v Everton, Crystal Palace v Newcastle United and Sunderland v Stoke City.

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: The contestants are summoned to the V&A Museum of Childhood, where Lord Sugar instructs them to become party planners. The teams have two days to set up and host a children's party for some high-spending clients, giving them the challenge of keeping an eye on profits and dealing with demanding customers. For one team, a massive oversight threatens the success of the task, and one member risks spoiling the birthday girl's day by attempting to keep a tight rein on the budget. On the other team, the entrepreneurs' efforts miss the mark with a lacklustre assault course, a mix up over the birthday cake, and a blunder with the party gifts.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features.

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker introduces highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Manchester City v Southampton at the Etihad Stadium and Leicester City v Manchester United at the King Power Stadium. The Saints have been in fine form lately following a stuttering start to the season, while Leicester were aiming to continue their outstanding campaign against their illustrious visitors. Plus, Aston Villa v Watford, Bournemouth v Everton, Crystal Palace v Newcastle United and Sunderland v Stoke City.

programme.title: The Andrew Marr Show
programme.desc: Round-up of the week's stories, featuring interviews with key figures in politics and current affairs, and leafing through the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 9.00.

programme.title: Fern Britton Meets
programme.desc: New series. The former Boyzone singer discusses how his faith has helped him to cope with the death of his bandmate Stephen Gately.

programme.title: Sunday Politics
programme.desc: The week's events at Westminster, presented by Andrew Neil. Including news and a regional round-up.

programme.title: Live Formula 1
programme.desc: Suzi Perry presents coverage of the 19th and final round of the season from the Yas Marina Circuit (Start-time 1.00pm), where Lewis Hamilton will look to end the season in style despite having already secured the drivers' championship at the United States Grand Prix in October. Hamilton is one of only three men to have triumphed here since the inaugural race in 2009, with Sebastian Vettel and Kimi Raikkonen the other drivers to have taken the chequered flag.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Highlights of the series from house-hunts in Somerset. Johnnie Irwin learns how to make Cheddar cheese and Jules Hudson checks out sand sculptures in Weston-Super-Mare.

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: John Craven visits Chatsworth House as the doors open to 100,000 visitors, and EastEnders' June Brown discusses how her faith influences her performance.

programme.title: The Hunt
programme.desc: Examining the hunting methods of aquatic predators. The vastness of oceans means that wildlife is scattered over a large area, and animals often have to travel great distances in search of food. Blue whales' great size proves useful in their search for krill, while frigate birds have developed a clever means of catching food without having to land on water. Also featuring footage of sharks, sea lions, spinner dolphins, albatross and sargassum fish.

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: John Craven visits a seed bank in Shropshire, where the Woodland Trust is working to preserve Britain's endangered trees. Ellie Harrison meets artist Matt Sewell and learns how he captures the character of birds in his art. Adam Henson investigates a plan to paint cattle to make them more visible to drivers at night, and Tom Heap reports on plans to use insects as feed for farm animals.

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing
programme.sub-title: Strictly Come Dancing: The Results: Part Two
programme.desc: Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman reveal the results of last night's viewers' votes. The two lowest scoring couples must then compete in a dance-off, with judges Len Goodman, Darcey Bussell, Bruno Tonioli and Craig Revel Horwood deciding which couple is eliminated from the contest. Plus, a musical performance from Adam Lambert and a close-up look at recent routines in Len's Lens.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the second visit in this series to Plas Newydd on the Isle of Anglesey. The team examine rarities including a cabinet with a secret function, a magazine rack made by celebrated designer Piero Fornasetti, a collection of historical items related to deafness, a Chinese silver punchbowl and a photo that has a connection to the Apollo 11 mission.

programme.title: The Hunt
programme.desc: Examining animals on the hunt in deserts and grasslands, where prey has nowhere to hide - but neither do predators, making the element of surprise difficult to come by. Cheetahs use their unmatched speed to solve this problem, while lions have learned to use desert storms to conceal their approach and caracals are able to blend into the tall dry grass. The programme also features footage of bald eagles stalking snow geese, hot rod ants who rely on the sun to kill their food, and headlight beetles that lure termites to their death with an eerie glow.

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman introduces highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Tottenham Hotspur v Chelsea at White Hart Lane and Norwich City v Arsenal at Carrow Road. Spurs were looking to add to the champions' woes by adding yet another defeat to their names, while the Gunners were aiming to maintain their title challenge against the Canaries. Plus, West Ham United v West Bromwich Albion and Liverpool v Swansea City.

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Mr Khan opens a fried chicken shop, having kept it secret from Mrs Khan, who invites him along to watch her tango class demonstration after deciding she and her husband need to have more 'together time'. Matters become more complicated when the shop manager (guest star Ronni Ancona) takes a shine to Amjad. Comedy, with Adil Ray.

programme.desc: Hollywood icon Johnny Depp graces Graham's sofa, alongside Sherlock actor Benedict Cumberbatch, Depp's co-star in the new mobster movie Black Mass. Daniel Radcliffe is taking another important step to brushing away his Harry Potter association in the upcoming film Victor Frankenstein, and he and co-star James McAvoy also share a natter with the host. Plus, music from recently reformed Irish group the Corrs and Graham challenges more audience members to regale him with anecdotes from the dreaded red chair.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Matt Allwright reveals how forged documents are being used to smuggle illegal food and animal products into the UK. Plus, a bogus e-mail that cost a couple nearly £100,000.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore properties about to be auctioned in south Wales and the Scottish Borders, as well as a piece of land in Kent, meeting the new owners after the sales and tracking their progress as they aim to make money from their investments.

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed
programme.desc: Staff at an Italian restaurant prepare for a visit from Hollywood star Al Pacino, while a trainee guide dog is on the street to take on its biggest challenge yet.

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville examine the secrets of the food business and whether special offers are always what they seem.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Antiques experts Christina Trevanion and Kate Bateman help two teams search for items at Kent County Showground in Detling, with the Reds featuring the show's oldest participant.

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Valerie finds the courage to share her secret, and Mrs Tembe stands up to Brian 'Hutch' Hutchinson - with terrifying consequences. Medical drama, starring Sarah Moyle.

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: New series. The return of the Australian detective drama set in 1959, starring Craig McLachlan. Lucien investigates when a champion rower drowns after being thrown in a lake to celebrate a winning a race, and begins to suspect foul play.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson and Alistair Appleton help two couples search for properties in the Worcestershire countryside, and offer tips on buying in the county. Meanwhile, away from the house-hunt, Jules enjoys a ride on the historic Severn Valley Railway and Alistair helps out with a restoration project in the West Midlands.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Will Axon and Michael Baggot value items in Ashbourne, Derbyshire, including a pearlware cow and an Asprey and Co picnic set. Paul Martin visits the Peak District to experience the thrills of harness racing.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: The first visit of the week to the One Show studio, where Matt Baker and Alex Jones present the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat.

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Matt Allwright investigates bike helmets for sale that fail safety tests, as well as counterfeit pesticides that could be heading for UK farms, and the problem of fake supermarket savings stamps.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Stacey grows concerned when she finds Shabnam on a supervised visit with Jade which she didn't tell her about - and the friends soon fall out when the would-be mum tries to manipulate the youngster. Mick comes up with an idea to distract Elaine from the wedding preparations, although they soon have more to worry about when Stacey lets slip about Shabnam's visit with Jade. Babe has a Christmas surprise for the Carters, while Kathy receives her sentencing in court.

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Richard Bilton reports on corruption in one of Britain's biggest companies, uncovering evidence that employees bribed civil servants and politicians across Africa -undermining a United Nations campaign to save lives in the process. He challenges the officials who allegedly took the cash and asks whether the company will now be prosecuted.

programme.title: Tomorrow's Food
programme.desc: Comedian Dara O Briain and the team of experts examine more of the science transforming how food is grown, bought and eaten. Angela Hartnett meets a robot that can mimic all the moves of a leading chef, Shini Somara heads to Japan to discover if technology can beat willpower in the world of weight-loss and greengrocer Chris Bavin finds out if the British public will ever accept insects as an appetising snack. Plus, Dara discovers how forensic science is tackling the billion-pound business of food fraud.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Comedian Jo Brand takes over the reins for an extended edition of the satirical current affairs quiz, with stand-up Josh Widdicombe and Liberal Democrats leader Tim Farron joining regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's events.

programme.title: Doctor in the House

He starts by looking into husband Ray's back pain, from which he has suffered for decades, despite looking fit and running his own gym. He also investigates the cause of Ray's five-year-old son's eczema, and draws up a plan of lifestyle changes to improve the family's general state of health. At the end of his intervention, Ray, his partner Rachel and son Lucas are tested to measure just how much of an impact the resident medic has had.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin explore contrasting properties in Ipswich, Hackney and Llanhilleth in Wales.

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed
programme.desc: Protesting taxi drivers bring traffic to a standstill, while cosmetic chain Lush prepare for the opening of their biggest store, and a secret shopper searches for fake handbags.

programme.desc: Julia Somerville, Angela Rippon and Gloria Hunniford investigate foods that, for whatever reason, have proved controversial.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two teams are challenged to scour an antiques fair and pick up bargains to sell for profit at auction.

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Heston is surprised to find himself appointed executor in a patient's will. Meanwhile, it is the day of Niamh's photo shoot, and Mrs Tembe's attack causes ripples.

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: The death of a local farmer leads Blake into Ballarat's murky world of late-night, back-street gambling and two brothers with contrasting fortunes.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton and Nicki Chapman travel across Devon to help two couples find their dream rural retreats, and offer hints and tips on buying in the area. Away from the search, Alistair samples local gastro delicacies, while Nicki spends time at a fair.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Adam Partidge and Catherine Southon visit Todmorden, West Yorkshire, where they examine items including a piece of local history made from cast iron and an old horse-racing game. Presenter Paul Martin also travels to the Pennines to explore the modern landmarks called Panopticons.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat, hosted by Matt Baker and Alex Jones.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: A nervous Buster and Shirley prepare for Jade's hearing, only to end up arguing with Mick when he accidentally lets slip about Shabnam previously taking the youngster without permission. Across the Square, Shabnam feels optimistic, until Stacey tells her Shirley now knows what happened - and she is planning to tell the judge. Meanwhile, Ian is frustrated when the council refuse to get a Christmas tree for the Square, so he comes up with the perfect way of promoting his business, and Claudette and Kim continue to bicker.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Arthur and Morven struggle to rekindle their friendship after clashing over patient care, while Dom is distracted by a patient that he has fallen for and struggles to concentrate on the case of a nun who has lost her voice. Meanwhile, Zosia's confidence that she can impress Jac takes a knock when she sees a question mark against her name on a board in Jac's office.

programme.title: Capital
programme.desc: As the 'We Want What You Have' campaign intensifies, the worried residents of Pepys Road demand greater action from the police. However, while DI Mill looks for a breakthrough, other forces continue to transform the fortunes of the road's inhabitants. Returning home after her Christmas break, Arabella is concerned to find that Roger is refusing to fall into line - and rather than getting the house in order, he's hired the alluring Matya to help with the kids. Bryan Dick, Rachael Stirling and Zrinka Cvitesic star.

programme.title: Imagine
programme.sub-title: David Chipperfield: A Place To Be?
programme.desc: Acclaimed British architect David Chipperfield talks to Alan Yentob about his work in Berlin, his love of the city and its history and the 11 years spent on the transformation of the Neues Museum. After successes at the Hepworth Gallery, Wakefield, and Turner Contemporary Margate, he is now embarking on his most prestigious project, a new gallery for the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York.

programme.title: Possession
programme.desc: Rival academics get embroiled in the hunt for proof that Victorian poets Randolph Henry Ash and Christabel LaMotte were having an affair - but their rivalry is tempered by a seemingly irresistible attraction between them. Drama from playwright Neil LaBute, starring Gwyneth Paltrow, Aaron Eckhart, Jeremy Northam, Jennifer Ehle, Lena Headey and Tom Hickey.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: This edition exposes the trade in fire blankets with fraudulent safety claims and the fake tattoo inks that could be lethal. Plus, suspects running counterfeit operations at home.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a piece of land in Kent, a flat in London and a semi-detached property in Durham. They then speak to the buyers about how much they paid for them at auction, and what their plans are for the future.

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed
programme.desc: The developers of an Oxford Street building want to get rid of the squatters that have taken over in protest, while a passenger is taken ill at a busy underground station.

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville explore whether the labels on what people buy always tell the full story.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: In Derby, antiques experts Jonathan Pratt and Nick Hall help two teams find interesting items to take to auction and make a profit. Presented by Tim Wonnacott.

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Sid's car crash puts him in a sticky situation with an uninsured driver, while Valerie's absences trouble Mrs Tembe. Karen, on the other hand, is concerned about Valerie's health.

credits.actor: Dr Jimmi Clay - Adrian Lewis Morgan

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: When a young woman is shot dead at a bonfire night celebration, the police immediately arrest an aboriginal boy who was standing near her with a gun in his hand. However, Blake realises the murder is not that simple and is forced to challenge the racist bias of both the police and the whole town. Starring Craig McLachlan.

credits.actor: Chief Supt William Munro - Craig Hall
Kevin Van Der Hayden - Andy McPhee

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Following two couples as they search for their dream rural homes in Kent. Away from the hunt, Jules views an accidental and unintentional wartime asset and Jonnie learns the art of traffic control on a busy stretch of water.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Kate Bateman and Mark Stacey value items in Herne Bay, Kent, including a pair of bronze vases and a Moorcroft cruet set. Presenter Paul Martin also visits a castle in Rochester, which boasts the highest keep in England.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Alex Jones host the live magazine show, with a team of roving reporters presenting stories of interest from around the UK, plus big-name studio guests.

programme.title: Cuffs
programme.desc: Felix and Carl suspect a Tug Master at the local harbour may be part of a drug-smuggling ring, but Carl's personal life threatens to collapse the operation. As Jo's final sergeant's exam looms, she must confront her life decisions while working on an internet dating scam, and Lino meets a potential love match - but Donna cannot stand her. Elsewhere, Jake witnesses a darker side to his mentor when Ryan loses his temper after revelations about his son. Police drama, starring Ashley Walters and Jacob Ifan.

credits.actor: Ch Supt Robert Vickers - Peter Sullivan
Custody Sgt Melanie Pyke - Karen Bryson

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: The stakes are raised as Lord Sugar summons the eight remaining candidates to Southbank Tower and gives them the task of acting as estate agents. The entrepreneurs have two days to sell mid-range and high-end properties to London's most discerning buyers, with the team that makes the most sales and commission winning the task. One team uses their charm to win over clients, while the other fails to strike a big deal with their over-familiar approach. For some candidates, capitalising on London's property market comes easily, but for others it is a nightmare as they finish empty-handed, having failed to secure any deals.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan comperes an evening of stand-up at London's Hammersmith Apollo, treating the audience to his own brand of humour before introducing routines by comedy circuit stars Jason Byrne and Stewart Francis.

programme.title: Film 2015
programme.desc: Danny Leigh and Claudia Winkleman are joined by critic Kevin Maher to review the drama Victor Frankenstein, starring Daniel Radcliffe and James McAvoy, and the Christmas comedy The Night Before.

programme.title: The Road
programme.desc: The world is devastated by a cataclysm that wipes out all the plants and animals and leaves the few remaining humans desperately struggling to survive. A man and his son make an arduous journey across a desolate America inhabited by cannibals, in search of sanctuary further south. Drama based on Cormac McCarthy's novel, starring Viggo Mortensen, Kodi Smit-McPhee, Charlize Theron, Robert Duvall and Guy Pearce.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Fluffy hot water bottles that could prove fatal, fake wood-burning stoves and dodgy ladders that could lead to disaster. Plus, the technology used to reveal counterfeit documents.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin explore houses in Croydon, Surrey and the Welsh village of Maerdy, and a former barber's shop in Sutton Coldfield, Birmingham.

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed
programme.desc: Oxford Circus trials the closure of the ticket office and photographer Andy Barnes hopes to get a good picture of former Corrie star Michelle Keegan when she visits House of Fraser.

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville continue their reports, investigating whether everyday food products offer good value for money.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Philip Serrell and Thomas Planet help two teams in Dorking, Surrey, search for valuable items to take to auction. Presenter Tim Wonnacott explores a picture gallery in Petworth House, West Sussex.

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Daniel is confused by a patient's memory loss problem, while Jimmi puts the brakes on Mrs Tembe's latest idea. Guest starring John Challis (Only Fools and Horses' Boycie).

credits.actor: Dr Jimmi Clay - Adrian Lewis Morgan

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: When a communist student is found dead after a run-in with local workers, Blake sifts through the politics and intrigue to find the killer. Crime drama, starring Craig McLachlan.

credits.actor: Chief Supt William Munro - Craig Hall

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson and Nicki Chapman help two couples find rural homes in Somerset, and offer hints and tips on buying in the area. The presenters also discover a unique way to brush a horse's tail, and investigate some unusual excavations.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Anita Manning and Thomas Plant help value items at Balbirnie House near Glenrothes, Fife, including a Japanese ivory panel and a pristine 1950s train set. Presenter Paul Martin also uncovers a secret chapter in the area's history.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Alex Jones present the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Tensions continue to grow at the Mitchells' when Ben and Abi reveal they are looking for somewhere else to live. Sharon tries to bring the family back together by organising a Christmas card photo shoot - but quickly realises Phil has been drinking again. As Shabnam awaits the results of the pregnancy test, Kush is worried about his wife's behaviour and forces her to admit the truth - although when Carmel later spots her son arguing with Stacey, she puts two and two together. Ian has doubts about funding the Albert Square Christmas tree and Kim is upset when Vincent demands she takes the festive decorations down. Jane suggests Bobby and Kathy should swap rooms, but the youngster is upset by the idea.

programme.title: Watchdog
programme.desc: Sophie Raworth, Matt Allwright, Chris Hollins and Michelle Ackerley present the consumer show, including an undercover investigation into what is preventing some people enjoying their Christmas party. Plus, the festive shopping shambles at one of the biggest high street retailers a visit from Matt Allwright for another rogue trader. Last in the series.

programme.title: Doctor in the House
programme.desc: Dr Rangan Chatterjee spends time with the D'Arcys from Shropshire to give them a health MOT. The family has a love of fast food, but when mum Dotti discovers she has Type 2 diabetes, the GP sets out to improve her diet. Meanwhile, it turns out that dad Russ's firefighter career is more deskbound than active, so Rangan encourages a radical lifestyle change. At the end of his intervention, the family are tested to measure just how much of an impact the resident medic has had. Last in the series.

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby chairs the debate from Birmingham, with a panel of politicians, business people, journalists and celebrities facing topical questions from the audience.

programme.title: This Week
programme.desc: Andrew Neil presents the result of today's by-election in Oldham West and Royton, which came about after the death of long-serving Labour MP Michael Meacher, with guests' thoughts on how it will affect the political landscape.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Matt Allwright investigates the fake clothing banks that are fleecing kind-hearted people. Plus, the counterfeit identity cards that could lead to a construction site catastrophe, and the fake steam mop that could give its users a real shock.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore properties about to be auctioned - two bungalows in Devon, a terrace house in Stoke-on-Trent and a Glasgow flat - before speaking to the buyers about their plans, and later visiting to see how the new owners have fared.

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed
programme.desc: A policeman has a shift to remember as he takes on dangerous cars, drunks and rooftop intruders, and the secret world of bicycle couriers is examined. Last in the series.

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville debunk some of the claims and preconceptions about foods and their apparent health benefits. Last in the series.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: In Berkshire, a team of men and a team of women are challenged to scour an antiques fair at Newbury racecourse seeking bargains to sell for profit at auction. Trusty experts Natasha Raskin and Mark Stacey guide the competitors around the fair, while Tim Wonnacott travels to Winchester Cathedral in Hampshire to investigate its celebrated West Window.

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Valerie's Marilyn Monroe dream turns into a nightmare, and author Faye Durran's positive thinking does not seem to have worked for her ex-husband.

credits.actor: Dr Jimmi Clay - Adrian Lewis Morgan

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: A famous actress surprises everyone at the Colonists Club by dropping dead on stage, while Chief Superintendent Munro is convinced the killer is in the room.

credits.actor: Chief Supt Matthew Lawson - Joel Tobeck

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: An extended edition of the programme. Jules Hudson and Alistair Appleton help two couples who are looking for homes in rural Dorset, and offer hints and tips on buying in the area. Away from the search, Jules heads to the coast and finds out about a scheme helping fishermen to protect the sea and also their livelihoods, while Alistair meets up with another couple who appeared on the programme more than ten years ago.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: David Barby and David Fletcher value heirlooms at Truro Cathedral, while Paul Martin learns about the disaster at Levant Mine near St Just in Cornwall - one of the worst such incidents in the region's history.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones presents the final show of the week, featuring the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Stand-up star David O'Doherty, Pointless co-host Richard Osman, comedienne Susan Calman and weather presenter Carol Kirkwood join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the panel show, trying to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon hosts.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: It's the day of the Christmas tree light switch-on and as the locals turn out in force, Ian is upset that Jane is not by his side - unaware she is at home, engaged in a blazing argument with Bobby. Sharon comes up with a solution to Phil's drinking problem, Babe continues to bicker with Cora - until Nancy tells her aunt she isn't worth bothering with - and Kim has a heart-to-heart with Vincent over his hatred of Christmas - although she gets a big shock later when she goes looking for her present.

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Mr Khan discovers his grandson Mo might be psychic, so immediately sets the youngster to work picking his lottery numbers. Meanwhile, Amjad's mother threatens to solve Shazia and Amjad's housing problems by taking them with her to live in Bradford - resulting in Mrs Khan being rushed to hospital with stress. Comedy, starring Adil Ray and Shobu Kapoor.

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts as SNP MP Alex Salmond and comedian Sara Pascoe join regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to take potshots at the week's headlines and other stories.

programme.title: Peter Kay's Car Share
programme.desc: An unfortunate event at work means John and Kayleigh get to take the morning off together, allowing them to get to know each other a little bit better. However, the assistant manager is shocked when his passenger reveals what she gets up to on an evening with her elderly neighbour. Sitcom, starring Peter Kay and Sian Gibson.

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Thor star Chris Hemsworth, who is spearheading the new whaling movie In the Heart of the Sea, takes a space on Graham's sofa, alongside the film's director Ron Howard. American comedian and actress Lily Tomlin - Oscar-tipped for her role in Grandma - also appears, and accomplished comic Kevin Bridges is on hand to help lighten the mood. Plus, Shirley Bassey performs The Christmas Song (Chestnuts Roasting on an Open Fire), a collaborative release with vocal harmony trio Blake.

programme.title: Josh
programme.desc: When Owen's friend from home, Teabag, visits, he treats the flatmates to a weekend full of 'lad banter'. Meanwhile, Josh's friend Mike is having girlfriend trouble and Kate asks Geoff to redecorate her room, with mixed results. Sitcom, starring comedians Josh Widdicombe and Jack Dee.

programme.title: Old School
programme.desc: An embittered lawyer decides to relive the wild, crazy days of his youth after his girlfriend is unfaithful, and enlists the help of two equally disillusioned friends in setting up a fraternity house next to his former college campus. Comedy, starring Luke Wilson, Will Ferrell, Vince Vaughn and Juliette Lewis.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Singer Will Young faces his food heaven or hell, courtesy of chefs Kuba Winkowski and Theo Randall. Plus, culinary highlights from shows featuring Rick Stein and Mary Berry.

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: Food writer Nigella Lawson examines how different days require certain types of food, sharing her favourite menu to help get that balance right in the kitchen. She prepares a light salad of salmon, avocado, watercress and pumpkin seeds, and a chicken shawarma with an array of spices, sauces and flatbreads - a dish inspired by a spit-roasted Lebanese kebab that is perfect for feeding a crowd. Nigella also creates two sweet treats, a glossy liquorice and blackcurrant chocolate cake, and chocolate chip cookie dough pots served with ice-cream or creme fraiche.

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Dan Walker and guests review the week's action and look ahead to forthcoming fixtures in the Premier League, including Manchester United v West Ham United, and FA Cup second round. The Hammers' away form has been one of the talking points of the season so far, with wins at Arsenal, Liverpool and Manchester City already under their belts, so they will be hoping to add Louis van Gaal's Red Devils to that impressive list.

programme.title: Live Snooker: UK Championship
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine presents coverage of the first semi-final from the Barbican Centre in York, as the tournament widely regarded as the second-most prestigious on the calendar continues. Ronnie O'Sullivan made it to his fifth UK final at the 2014 event, coming through a titanic battle with Stuart Bingham, who would gain his revenge in the World Championship quarter-finals a few months later. Judd Trump defeated Stephen Maguire 6-4 to progress to his second UK final, having won the title in 2011. With a commentary team including Stephen Hendry, Steve Davis and Dennis Taylor.

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of this afternoon's results from the Premier League, Championship, FA Cup and Scottish Leagues.

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: CBeebies' Andy Day, crime writer Ann Cleeves, actor and comedian Tom Rosenthal and BBC economics editor Robert Peston take turns in the infamous black chair, answering questions on the Back to the Future films, the Shetland Islands, flags of the world and David Bowie 1966 to 1976. Hosted by John Humphrys.

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present another themed edition of the general knowledge quiz, inviting high-profile figures from the world of business. This time, Four Rooms duo Peter Ratcliffe and Jeff Salmon take on Ann Summers Chief Executive Jacqueline Gold and Dragons' Den investor Richard Farleigh, The Apprentice winner Tim Campbell and former rival Saira Khan, and lingerie entrepreneur Michelle Mone and former BBC business correspondent Declan Curry.

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing
programme.desc: Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman present as the celebrity contestants and their professional partners prepare for another week of themed performances. This time, the six remaining couples will be challenged to recreate numbers from the classic musicals of the stage and screen, as Len Goodman, Darcey Bussell, Bruno Tonioli and Craig Revel Horwood appraise their performances. Once the judges scores have been decided and the dancefloor is cleared for the evening, the voting lines will open, giving viewers at home a chance to decide which two pairs will oppose each other in tomorrow's dance-off, with the least successful facing elimination.

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: The Doctor faces a bittersweet homecoming as, betrayed and trapped, with both his hearts broken, he demonstrates just how far he would be willing to go if someone took everything he cared about from him. With his quest to reach Gallifrey seemingly over, the Time Lord engages his own people in a struggle that will take him to the very end of time itself, but who is the mysterious 'Hybrid' mentioned in the Gallifreyan prophecy? And just what was it the Doctor left behind as his 'confession'? Peter Capaldi stars in the series finale, but will return later this year alongside Alex Kingston's River Song for the traditional Christmas special. Last in the series.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: As winter sets in and the festive season approaches, treacherous conditions, bitter cold snaps and the odd bit of over-enthusiastic celebration have a habit of taking their toll on the emergency services. The same is true for the staff of Holby's accident and emergency department, and while the harsh conditions provide an opportunity for some people to come together, they also threaten to tear others apart. Medical drama, starring Amanda Mealing, Charles Venn and RIchard Winsor.

programme.title: The National Lottery Live
programme.desc: Ore Oduba presents as the all-important winning numbers are revealed.

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Manchester United v West Ham United at Old Trafford and Chelsea v Bournemouth at Stamford Bridge. Slaven Bilic had already led his Hammers side to away wins at Arsenal, Liverpool and Manchester City, so will have been hoping to add United to that impressive list of scalps. The champions met Bournemouth for only the sixth time ever, with both sides struggling at the bottom of the table and in need of a morale-boosting win. Plus, action from Arsenal v Sunderland, Southampton v Aston Villa, Stoke City v Manchester City, Swansea City v Leicester City, Watford v Norwich City and West Bromwich Albion v Tottenham Hotspur.

One team uses their charm to win over clients, while the other fails to strike a big deal with their over-familiar approach. For some candidates, capitalising on London's property market comes easily, but for others it is a nightmare as they finish empty-handed, having failed to secure any deals.

programme.desc: Round-up of the week's stories, featuring interviews with key figures in politics and current affairs, and leafing through the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 9.00.

programme.title: Fern Britton Meets
programme.desc: Interviews with the Olympic athlete, in which he discusses his faith, his current work as a coach for Team GB and the failed drugs test that marred the end of his career.

programme.title: Sunday Politics
programme.desc: The week's events at Westminster, presented by Andrew Neil. Including news and a regional round-up.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Jonathan Pratt and Henry Meadows help two teams search for valuable items along London's bustling Portobello Road, while presenter Tim Wonnacott visits a Hampstead house packed with treasures.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps a young family currently living in the city to search for a home in the Dorset countryside. Away from the house hunt, the presenter dons a hat and apron and learns how to make sausages.

programme.title: Live FA Cup Football
programme.sub-title: FA Cup Final Score: 2015/16 Second Round
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents an FA Cup edition of the football results and report show, bringing the key moments and reports from today's second-round matches, as the clubs look to book their places in the third-round draw, with potentially lucrative ties against Premier League opposition ahead.

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Pam Rhodes and Noddy Holder present a special episode for St Nicholas' Day, featuring carols from around the country.

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Pam Rhodes and Noddy Holder present a special episode for St Nicholas' Day, featuring carols from around the country.

programme.title: The Hunt
programme.desc: Examining animals on the hunt in deserts and grasslands, where prey has nowhere to hide - but neither do predators, making the element of surprise difficult to come by. Cheetahs use their unmatched speed to solve this problem, while lions have learned to use desert storms to conceal their approach and caracals are able to blend into the tall dry grass. The programme also features footage of bald eagles stalking snow geese, hot rod ants who rely on the sun to kill their food, and headlight beetles that lure termites to their death with an eerie glow.

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison and Joe Crowley take a tour of some of Scotland's most remote scenic areas, visiting Britain's highest road, which runs 2,000 feet above sea level, meeting a couple who have made a new life as crofters, and discovering a fish that could solve all the salmon industry's problems. Plus, Tom Heap reports on the rising number of traffic accidents on rural roads and Adam Henson examines how straw may be the key to the UK's future energy production. Including Weather For The Week Ahead.

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing
programme.sub-title: Strictly Come Dancing: The Results: Part Two
programme.desc: Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman reveal the results of the viewers' votes from last night's musicals themed episode and reveal which couples are safely through to next week's semi final. The two lowest scoring pairs must face each other in a dance-off, with judges Len Goodman, Darcey Bussell, Bruno Tonioli and Craig Revel Horwood deciding who gets eliminated from the contest. Plus, Josh Groban performs a song from a classic musical.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from the Queen's private residence at Balmoral, Aberdeenshire, where items brought in to be valued include a ceramic pot made by Pablo Picasso, a giant telescope and a diamond tiara. Plus, military specialist Mark Smith challenges Fiona to spot the fake among a collection of rare medals.

programme.title: The Hunt
programme.desc: A look at how predators hunt on the coast, both in the water and on land. The environment is in a constant state of change as the tides ebb and flow, so any opportunities to feed must be taken quickly. The programme features footage of dolphins, octopuses, monkeys, fishing wolves and one of the world's largest ever gatherings of humpback whales.

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action between Newcastle United and Liverpool at St James' Park. The Magpies were looking for a win to move them up the table and away from the relegation zone, but knew they were in for a tough game against Jurgen Klopp's Reds. Steve McClaren's men will have been able to take confidence from last season's corresponding game, however, which ended in a 1-0 victory thanks to substitute Ayoze Perez's late strike.

programme.title: Sister Rita to the Rescue
programme.desc: New series. Documentary following life at the Lalley Centre in Collyhurst, Manchester, where nun Sister Rita Lee and her team offer advice and support to those in need. In the first edition, she has to act fast when it seems not everyone coming to her foodbank is genuinely in need. Denis Lawson narrates.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a terraced house in Stoke-on-Trent, Staffordshire, a large office in Ashford, Kent, and a Victorian property in Plymouth. They then speak to the buyers about their plans for the buildings, and how much they paid for them at auction.

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed
programme.desc: New series. PC Andy Pescott takes errant pedicab riders to court to try to stop their rule-bending, and the programme follows bus and tube drivers as they face their daily challenges.

programme.title: Family Finders
programme.desc: The Salvation Army helps 80-year-old Violet Rossini search for her sister Kathleen, who she has not seen for 72 years.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Ben Cooper and Philip Serrell are on hand in Builth Wells, Powys, as two young farmers take on a husband and wife, scouring an antiques fair to pick up bargains.

programme.title: Doctors
programme.sub-title: The Many Shades of Joan Gray
programme.desc: A woman gets a birthday present that leaves her whole family in shock, while Karen is up to something and Ruhma plays therapist.

credits.actor: Dr Jimmi Clay - Adrian Lewis Morgan

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: Lucien investigates when one of Ballarat's most prominent surgeons is found dead on his own operating table, and ends up being drawn into a web of jealousy and sexual intrigue. Meanwhile, as Chief Superintendent Munro's enmity towards the doctor continues, an old ally returns from Melbourne. Australian detective drama, starring Craig McLachlan.

credits.actor: Chief Supt William Munro - Craig Hall

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a newlywed couple escape the hustle and bustle of London and find their first home together in rural Cambridgeshire on a budget of £325,000. Meanwhile, away from the property hunt, Alistair meets a farmer who is diversifying with an unusual kind of livestock.

programme.title: James Martin - Home Comforts at Christmas
programme.desc: New series. The chef demonstrates festive recipes, beginning by providing a host of clever tips and tricks to save time and stress on the big day. With guest Michael Parkinson.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: David Fletcher and James Lewis evaluate antiques and collectibles at St John's Minster in Preston, finding ceramic tiles made by Poole pottery and a large watch that proves more valuable than expected. Meanwhile, Paul Martin visits Leighton Hall in Lancashire, home of the Gillow furniture-making family.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: The first visit of the week to the One Show studio, where Matt Baker and Alex Jones present the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat.

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Matt Allwright investigates the fake sausages that are being stacked at the stalls of some farmers' markets, and the counterfeit bike parts that are risking the safety of Britain's cyclists.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: The highs and lows of life with the residents of Albert Square, Walford.

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: The Pakistan city of Karachi has become one of the most dangerous cities in the world over the past two years, as it's seen an onslaught of kidnappings, bombings and targeted assassinations by Taliban militants. The police are now fighting back, but are understaffed, under-resourced, and up against a committed enemy, with more than 160 officers killed in the line of duty in just 12 months. In this programme, Mobeen Azhar joins Superintendent Ijaz and his team as they try to regain control of the city from the Islamic fundamentalists.

programme.title: Tomorrow's Food
programme.desc: Chef Angela Hartnett heads to Holland to investigate the future of the burger and find out how a 3D printer could soon become an essential kitchen gadget. Dr Shini Somara gets a cooking lesson from a hi-tech kitchen table, greengrocer Chris Bavin visits America to learn how vegetables can be grown without sunlight, and Dara O Briain experiences a mindreading menu that knows what diners wants before they do. Last in the series.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Pointless co-host Alexander Armstrong takes over the reins for an extended edition of the satirical current affairs quiz, with MP and MSP Alex Salmond and comedian Sara Pascoe joining regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's events.

programme.title: Doctor in the House
programme.desc: Dr Rangan Chatterjee spends time with the D'Arcys from Shropshire to give them a health MOT. The family has a love of fast food, but when mum Dotti discovers she has Type 2 diabetes, the GP sets out to improve her diet. Meanwhile, it turns out that dad Russ's firefighter career is more deskbound than active, so Rangan encourages a radical lifestyle change. At the end of his intervention, the family are tested to measure just how much of an impact the resident medic has had. Last in the series.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.

programme.title: Sister Rita to the Rescue
programme.desc: The nun finds herself thrust onto the national stage when the Lalley Centre is chosen to pilot a new government scheme, while a woman fighting the system needs assistance.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Lucy Alexander and Dion Dublin meet the new owners of a flat in Little Chalfont, Buckinghamshire, a maisonette in Oldham and a terraced house in South Norwood, south-east London.

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed
programme.desc: A tube strike brings chaos to Oxford Street and John Lewis prepares to overhaul its homeware department, while London's Ice Bar gets a refit.

programme.title: Family Finders
programme.desc: The Salvation Army Family Tracing Unit helps Mary Kitchen from Huddersfield, West Yorkshire, track down her estranged brother Lennie, who she lost contact with more than 30 years ago. Plus, 81-year-old retired musician Linda Wright, who only found out she was adopted when she was 20 years old, asks genealogist Charlie Watson to lend a hand in finding out whether she has any living biological relatives.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: The teams head to the former RAF base of Hemswell in Lincolnshire, where experts Philip Serrell and Charles Hanson help them hunt down bargains. Meanwhile, Presenter Tim Wonnacott visits a legendary RAF base with an epic tale of Second World War bravery.

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Jimmi is appalled by one family's treatment of women, while Al realises that he and Mo are on different pages. Elsewhere, Valerie pushes Mrs Tembe to pursue an opportunity.

credits.actor: Dr Jimmi Clay - Adrian Lewis Morgan

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: A hotel owner finds a body in one of the rooms and Blake's investigation leads him to a woman in Mattie's care who has lost her memory after a car crash.

credits.actor: Chief Supt William Munro - Craig Hall
Chief Supt Matthew Lawson - Joel Tobeck

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a couple who want to be closer to their son to search for a property in rural Wiltshire, with a budget of £400,000 to spend. Away from the house hunt, the presenter meets a farmer from the county who is reviving a prehistoric tradition in his field.

programme.title: James Martin - Home Comforts at Christmas
programme.desc: The chef demonstrates festive food for inexperienced cooks, including puddings, Christmas Eve suppers and main course dishes. With Helen Skelton.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Elizabeth Talbot finds an early gramophone among the antiques at Stapleford Park in Leicestershire, while Mark Stacey reveals a fondness for big cats. Meanwhile, Paul Martin visits Thrumpton Hall in Nottinghamshire to examine its opulent Restoration staircase, and discovers a connection with Lord Byron through some interesting relics.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat, hosted by Matt Baker and Alex Jones.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: The highs and lows of life with the residents of Albert Square, Walford.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Jesse is forced to relive tragic events from the past when he treats the seriously ill sister of a former patient, while Jac's brusque manner puts her at odds with Fran, who questions her decision to discharge a patient without undergoing the operation she believes he needs. Cara hits it off with a flirtatious patient, leading to Fletch and Raf encouraging him to ask her out in a bid to cheer her up.

programme.title: Capital
programme.desc: As the police investigation into the 'we want what you have' campaign leads them in an unexpected direction, DI Mill hopes to secure a confession. The Kamal family's faith in one another is tested to the limit, but they must intervene in time before Shahid is forced to make an impossible decision, and Smitty makes a starting discovery as his new artwork reaches completion. Meanwhile, Roger has a change of fortune, forcing him to take drastic measures with Arabella, as their real feelings about one another are revealed. Last in the series.

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Alan Yentob presents a profile of Cuban ballet superstar Carlos Acosta as he embarks on a new production of Carmen for the Royal Ballet and plans to create his own dance company and foundation in his homeland. Transforming a derelict architectural treasure for his project, he is aiming to finish a project first begun by Fidel Castro and Che Guevara over 50 years ago.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Katherine Ryan comperes an evening of stand-up at London's Hammersmith Apollo, treating the audience to her own brand of humour and introducing routines by comedy circuit stars Henning Wehn and James Acaster.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Aled Jones helps a pair of cyclists searching for a property in Worcestershire with a budget of £600,000. The host also takes a trip to Kinver Edge to explore the county's curious history of cave housing.

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed
programme.desc: The undercover police crack down on a new trick used by distraction thieves on unsuspecting shoppers - a shoulder roll. Meanwhile, the launch of a French make-up line in Debenhams includes live body-painting in shop windows. Plus, the response team tasked with keeping London's buses on the road, and a specialist aerial photographer shows Oxford Street from above.

programme.title: Len and Ainsley's Big Food Adventure
programme.desc: Len Goodman has his first taste of Korean barbecue food and samples Swedish cuisine, and Ainsley Harriott cooks a salmon and mango salad inspired by the day's adventures.

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Six aspiring chefs compete in the cookery contest, beginning with a test of their basic skills. The first contestants must make the French dessert, a Floating Island, while the remaining three have to cook a blue steak with a green peppercorn sauce in 15 minutes. Finally, the six chefs cook their own signature dish for judges Monica Galetti, Gregg Wallace and Marcus Wareing. It is their last chance to show off their culinary talent before three of them are sent home, and three become quarter finalists.

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break.

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country. Presented by Andrew Neil and Jo Coburn.

programme.title: Michel Roux's Service
programme.desc: The trainees reach the final hurdle as they prepare for service at the chef's Michelin-starred restaurant Le Gavroche, with 50 leading figures from the industry booked in for lunch. Before the final challenge, Michel sends the group to work with his father Albert to help him decide which two have shown the most potential and should be awarded the life-changing scholarships. Last in the series.

programme.title: The Box
programme.desc: Three home cooks create dishes from a box put together by former Strictly Come Dancing dancer Vincent Simone. Then host James Martin selects the ingredients to go into three new boxes and they have to choose between a bird box, a shellfish box and a basic box. Last in the series.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off - Masterclass
programme.desc: Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood tackle the signature, technical and showstopper challenges from the second half of the series. Mary makes a swirling chocolate and orange tart, a Swedish princess torte and her own version of the two-tiered dobos torte, while Paul prepares mini sausage plaits and demystifies the kouign amann, which baffled the bakers in the tent.

programme.title: Cash in the Attic
programme.desc: Lorne Spicer and Paul Hayes meet Peter and Alice Gillespy, who hope to raise enough money from their family heirlooms to fund a trip to see the Northern Lights.

programme.title: Planet Dinosaur
programme.desc: The documentary series reaches the Jurassic period, when the first giant killers stalked Earth and lurked in the seas. North America was dominated by the allosaurus, an ambush hunter with a lethal bite, allowing it to bring down even the heavily armoured stegosaurus. Life in the oceans was just as deadly - a fossil found in the Arctic in 2008 turned out to be a colossal marine reptile. Named Predator X, the creature was 50ft long, weighed 45 tons and had a bite force unmatched by anything in the Jurassic seas.

programme.title: Planet Dinosaur
programme.desc: The documentary series focuses on the heavyweights of the dinosaur world, creatures that have only been unearthed in recent years. The 125ft-long Argentinosaurus, which roamed South America 95 million years ago, was the creature that eclipsed all others - and remains the largest dinosaur ever discovered. For years, these colossal plant-eaters were considered immune to attack from any predator - until the discovery of new giant killer the mapusaurus, whose fate was inextricably linked to the Argentinosaurus.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team visit the Weald & Downland Open Air Museum in Chichester, West Sussex, where items of interest include a cheque for £195 signed by the first Duke of Wellington, a bracelet gifted by the King of Siam, a rare watch with an unusual nickname and a collection of handcuffs and body restraints.

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows including Mastermind and Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing - It Takes Two
