programme.desc: Zoe Ball dishes the backstage gossip ahead of this weekend's show and there is a sneak peek at some of the costumes the celebs and their partners will be wearing, courtesy of designer Vicky Gill.

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Snooker stars Dennis Taylor and Willie Thorne take on the antiques challenge, travelling around the Home Counties with the help of experts Catherine Southon and Christina Trevanion before going head to head at an auction in Market Harborough.

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The best six chefs from the week battle it out in the third quarter-final, in which the judges test their pastry skills. First they ask them to make a sweet dish of their own invention from 10 ingredients including a fresh coconut, passionfruit, white chocolate and rum. After a double elimination, the remaining contestants have to cook two courses for food critics Tracey MacLeod, Jay Rayner and William Sitwell, before finding out who is going through to the knockout week.

programme.title: The Last Kingdom
programme.desc: Uhtred continues his quest to find his true identity - Saxon or Dane? The young warrior leads a raiding party to the south west on a mission for wealth and independence, but it takes an unexpected turn when he and his marauders become mercenaries for a Cornish king. Along the way he attracts the attention of a beautiful pagan queen - but eventually he is forced to return to Wessex and face the wrath of Alfred. Epic drama, starring Alexander Dreymon, David Dawson, Charlie Murphy, Amy Wren and Ian Hart.

programme.title: Russell Howard's Good News
programme.desc: Russell Howard offers his personal perspective on stories dominating the media, whether on TV, online or in print. The comedian also picks up on overlooked items that raise a smile and chats to someone involved in the news this week.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by James O'Brien.

programme.title: Dominic Sandbrook: Let Us Entertain You
programme.desc: Dominic Sandbrook explores the rise of the individual in post-war culture. The idea first took hold during the Victorian period - in the era of the novel and self-help - despite industrialisation leading to the growth of a collective identity. The concept of individual identity and self-determination reached fruition after the war, and saw the emergence of those such as John Lennon, John Self, Kate Bush, and the seemingly endless stream of TV talent show contestants. Last in the series.

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: German manufacturer Volkswagen was recently revealed to have been rigging pollution emission tests of their diesel engines, with millions of customers are still driving around in tainted cars. Richard Westcott investigates how the company used clever computer software to hide the true performance and reveals how the UK's cities have become shrouded by an invisible killer. Postponed from November 16.

programme.title: Dominic Sandbrook: Let Us Entertain You
programme.desc: Dominic Sandbrook explores the effects of the industrial revolution in Britain, looking at how it presaged an upheaval of British society and an overturning of traditional social hierarchies. For the first time, innovation, technical knowledge and entrepreneurial skills - rather than an accident of birth - were rewarded with wealth. However, rather than challenge and reshape society, men like Richard Arkwright and Josiah Wedgewood became the new aristocracy. Similarly, in post-war British culture, working class voices railing against the inequalities of society and calling for change often ended up as Lord of the Manor. Pop culture's reinforcement of old order has therefore led to an enduring fascination with class, history and breeding.

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: The Doctor and Clara are reunited with Rigsy, the 'pudding brained' grafitti artist who gained the Time Lord's respect by helping him face off an invasion by inter-dimensional beings known as the Boneless in Bristol. Together the trio investigate a strange alien world hidden on a street in the heart of London. They soon discover this unusual road is sheltering some of the most fearsome creatures in the universe - including the immortal Viking Ashildr, who the Time Lord last encountered in the 17th century in the guise of noblewoman-turned-brigand 'Lady Me'. Sci-fi adventure, guest starring Maisie Williams and Jovian Wade.

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin explore a semi in Chingford, London, a one-bedroom flat in Brighton and a Victorian terrace in Normanton, Derby.

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed
programme.desc: Undercover police set out to catch shoplifters red-handed, the John Lewis staff celebrate Burns Night and the Dominion Theatre gets ready for the opening of The Lord of the Dance.

programme.title: Len and Ainsley's Big Food Adventure
programme.desc: Len Goodman and Ainsley Harriott reach Cardiff, where the Strictly judge has his first taste of spaghetti and samples some German hospitality, and Ainsley cooks an Italian dish.

programme.title: Live Formula 1
programme.sub-title: Formula 1: Abu Dhabi Grand Prix - Practice One: 2015
programme.desc: Lee McKenzie presents from the Yas Marina Circuit, where the drivers begin preparations for the 19th and final round of the season. Last year, for the first time in history, drivers in this race received double points, giving the practice sessions even greater importance. However, the controversial ruling was dispensed with after just one year. With commentary by Ben Edwards and David Coulthard.

programme.title: Coast
programme.sub-title: Heart of the British Isles - A Grand Tour
programme.desc: The presenters take a tour of the Irish Sea, visiting every country in the British Isles. Neil Oliver learns about the inventions developed on the Isle of Man, including the world's largest waterwheel. Alice Roberts receives tips for surviving quicksand in Morecambe Bay, Mark Horton observes the remains of Isambard Kingdom Brunel's final work in Liverpool, and Nicholas Crane discovers why Anglesey is the site of some of Britain's biggest earthquakes.

programme.title: Planet Dinosaur
programme.desc: The documentary concludes by focusing on dinosaurs' extraordinary ability to adapt to their surroundings, including the nothronychus, a carnivore that gave up eating meat to survive. The film also reveals how, despite their success as hunters or foragers, the creatures fell victim to the deadly illness botulism, and suggests their ultimate downfall came about when a nine-mile-wide asteroid smashed into the Earth, triggering a cataclysmic chain of events that wiped out 60 per cent of all species on the planet. Last in the series.

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country, presented by Andrew Neil.

programme.title: Live Davis Cup Tennis
programme.sub-title: Tennis: Davis Cup Final: Belgium v Great Britain
programme.desc: Belgium v Great Britain. Sue Barker presents coverage of day one of the World Group's showpiece match, featuring the opening singles rubbers at Flanders Expo in Ghent. This is GB's first appearance in the final since 1978, when they lost 4-1 to the US at the Mission Hills Country Club in California. As ever, two-time Grand Slam winner Andy Murray will be leading the side, after inspiring the team to a 3-2 win over Australia in September's semi-final in Glasgow. With commentary by Jonathan Overend, John Lloyd and Jamie Baker.

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing - It Takes Two
programme.desc: Zoe Ball presents analysis of the couples' progress as they prepare for tomorrow night's show. Including reports from the studio rehearsals and interviews with celebrity fans.

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Journalists Naga Munchetty and Steph McGovern embark on the cross-country treasure-hunting challenge. Experts Charlie Ross and Charles Hanson are on hand to help the Breakfast presenters unearth bargains at shops and markets around Manchester, before they head to an auction in Knutsford, Cheshire, to discover whose haul will raise the greater sum of cash.

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites four contestants to take to the black chair in the general knowledge quiz, facing questions on specialist subjects The IT Crowd, North American Plains Indians from 1850 to 1910, Homer's Iliad and the history of Hong Kong from 1841 to 1997.

programme.title: An Island Parish: Falklands
programme.desc: The islanders receive an update on the oil exploration going on offshore. While many residents are excited about the possible benefits such a commodity could bring, others are concerned about the inevitable changes that will occur. Elsewhere, resident marine biologist Megan Tierney pioneers some research using a tracking system, and sets out to catch some Gentoo penguins so that she can find out where they go to feed during the winter. Meanwhile, the islanders practise their dance steps for the annual May Ball.

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo traces the early 20th-century roots of the Spanish Civil War, which divided his family and sent his father into exile. The former politician discovers a nation fractured at the time by social tensions and regional loyalties, which today offer a rich diversity of cultures to delight the tourist. After arriving in Majorca from Barcelona, Michael spoils himself enjoying spectacular scenic views aboard a 1912 vintage railway and a 1913 tram. He also gets trampled underfoot at the bottom of a Catalan 'people steeple' and learns to make the perfect paella. Last in the series.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Correctness and even intelligence go out of the window in this quiz, as host Stephen Fry awards points for answers he finds most interesting. This edition sees Bill Bailey, Jo Brand and Greg Davies join regular panellist Alan Davies to tackle miscellaneous marriage and mating matters.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emily Maitlis.

programme.title: Artsnight
programme.desc: The Conservative MP looks at how the British Empire impacted on art, architecture and literature, meeting Australian novelist Peter Carey to discuss the writer's obsession with early colonial life, as well as exploring Tate Britain's Artist and Empire exhibition. Plus, comedian Shazia Mirza discusses why fabric and clothing is so vital to the story of the Indian sub-continent.

programme.title: Moon
programme.desc: Astronaut Sam Bell has been working alone at an energy-generating base on the moon for three years and desperately longs to return home. After he is injured in an accident, he begins to discover the disturbing truth about the operation he is running, and is forced to question his own identity. Sci-fi drama, starring Sam Rockwell, with the voice of Kevin Spacey.

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby chairs the debate from the Manchester district of Wythenshawe, with a panel of politicians and celebrity guests facing topical questions from the audience.

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: A profile of the team involved in The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time, an award-winning play based on Mark Haddon's bestselling book. The story in the novel and the production is told by a 15-year-old boy who finds other people frightening and confusing. The film is interwoven with contributions from children and families who discuss the challenges they face living with autism.

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: NFL Highlights
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents action from week 11 of the NFL regular season, with fixtures including Minnesota Vikings v Green Bay Packers and Arizona Cardinals v Cincinnati Bengals.

programme.title: Tennessee's Partner
programme.desc: A tough, womanizing gambler known only as Tennessee narrowly avoids being murdered due to the intervention of Cowpoke, a lonesome traveller in town to meet his fiancee Goldie as she arrives on a steamboat. The two men strike up an friendship, but their newfound cameraderie is severely tested when Cowpoke's sweetheart arrives in town, and immediately attracts Tennessee's attention. Western, starring John Payne, Rhona Fleming, Coleen Gray and future US President Ronald Reagan.

programme.title: Formula 1
programme.sub-title: Formula 1: Abu Dhabi Grand Prix - Practice Two: 2015
programme.desc: Lee McKenzie presents action from the Yas Marina Circuit, where the drivers continued preparations for the 19th and final round of the season.

programme.title: Live Formula 1
programme.sub-title: Formula 1: Abu Dhabi Grand Prix - Practice Three
programme.desc: Lee McKenzie presents live coverage of the third practice session ahead of the 19th and final round of the campaign, held at the Yas Marina Circuit.

programme.title: Formula 1 Rewind
programme.desc: Suzi Perry presents highlights of three races from the archives - the 1996 Japanese Grand Prix, the 2011 Canadian Grand Prix and the 2014 Bahrain Grand Prix.

programme.title: Terry and Mason's Great Food Trip
programme.desc: Broadcaster Terry Wogan and London cabbie Mason McQueen visit Winchester, where they tuck into bangers at a local pub and sushi at a Wasabi Farm. They also meet an artist who is farming water buffalo, are given bread and beer at the Hospital of St Cross, and Mason has a go at fly-fishing for the first time and catches a trout.

programme.title: Terry and Mason's Great Food Trip
programme.desc: Terry Wogan and Mason McQueen arrive in Birmingham on the latest leg of their culinary journey. They take in the sights and sounds of the Bull Ring market, where they feast on the finest dim sum, take a canal trip through the heart of the city - leading to an impromptu ballet lesson for Mason - and head to the famous Balti Triangle, where they help to create a special Irish curry.

programme.title: Live Snooker: UK Championship
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine introduces coverage of the afternoon session at the Barbican Centre in York, where the second round in the prestigious ranking tournament is set to get under way, with four matches taking place in the main arena and four in a sports hall. All of the leading players had to start in the first round again this year before reaching the televised stage, and those who have progressed to this stage will compete on matches staged over the best of 11 frames. Commentators include Stephen Hendry, Dennis Taylor, John Parrott and John Virgo.

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the classified results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, Football League and Scotland.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the experts delve into Liverpool's rich musical heritage, from classical offerings to the pop hits of the Beatles.

programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down
programme.desc: The six remaining potters are challenged to make a garden sculpture out of slabs of clay and with a place in the semi-final at stake, their designs prove to be more ambitious than ever before. For their Spot Test, the hopefuls transform a chimney pot into a strawberry container, before trying to impress the judges by throwing the widest plate they can.

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo traces the early 20th-century roots of the Spanish Civil War, which divided his family and sent his father into exile. The former politician discovers a nation fractured at the time by social tensions and regional loyalties, which today offer a rich diversity of cultures to delight the tourist. After arriving in Majorca from Barcelona, Michael spoils himself enjoying spectacular scenic views aboard a 1912 vintage railway and a 1913 tram. He also gets trampled underfoot at the bottom of a Catalan 'people steeple' and learns to make the perfect paella. Last in the series.

programme.title: Japan: Earth's Enchanted Islands
programme.desc: Michelle Dockery narrates a documentary examining the wildlife of the east Asian country, beginning on the central island of Honshu. It is home to more than 100 million people, but most of it is mountainous and this wilderness is home to an astonishing range of wildlife, and people and nature are drawn together in the most unexpected ways.

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: Walker is accused of being a fifth columnist for smuggling Italian PoWs out of camp at night, but he claims to be patriotically furthering the war effort - while lining his own pockets at the same time. Comedy first broadcast in 1970, starring Arthur Lowe and James Beck.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts an extended edition of the notoriously obscure quiz show, in which he awards points for answers he finds most interesting. This edition sees Bill Bailey, Jo Brand and Greg Davies join regular panellist Alan Davies to tackle miscellaneous marriage and mating matters.

programme.title: Papadopoulos & Sons
programme.desc: Premiere. A Greek millionaire loses everything he has in a financial crisis, leaving him with only one asset - his share in the fish and chip shop his father used to run. He is forced to return to his roots and work with his laidback brother to revive the family business. Comedy, starring Stephen Dillane, Georgia Groome and Georges Corraface.

programme.title: Snooker: UK Championship
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine presents action from the second round at the Barbican Centre in York, where the matches were played over the best of 11 frames, in the second most prestigious ranking tournament on the calendar. Commentators include Ken Doherty, Steve Davis and Willie Thorne.

programme.title: Snooker: UK Championship Extra
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine introduces extended highlights from one of today's matches at the Barbican Centre in York, where the second round got under way. The commentary team includes Stephen Hendry and John Virgo.

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: The A to Z of TV Gardening
programme.desc: Carol Kirkwood looks at themes beginning with the letter E, as part of her alphabetical journey through the world of horticulture. Along the way, she gets inspiration and advice from some of the BBC's most popular gardening presenters.

programme.title: Big Dreams Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don helps amateur horticulturists who have small or average-sized gardens, but are planning to do something extraordinary with them. Today, a couple battle to turn a clay-clogged building site in Petworth, West Sussex, into a piece of Portugal, while another tackle years of overgrowth in their new back garden in their determination to create a productive space.

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: The shows comes from Dorset, where Ellie Harrison meets the members of a very special countrymen's club and goes looking for kingfishers at an urban bird reserve in Weymouth. Matt Baker visits a woodland architecture school, where local trees are used as building materials, Jules Hudson drops in to a historic family butcher's, Adam Henson takes stock on the farm, and Tom Heap weighs up the pros and cons of dredging Britain's ports.

programme.title: An Island Parish: Falklands
programme.desc: The islanders receive an update on the oil exploration going on offshore. While many residents are excited about the possible benefits such a commodity could bring, others are concerned about the inevitable changes that will occur. Elsewhere, resident marine biologist Megan Tierney pioneers some research using a tracking system, and sets out to catch some Gentoo penguins so that she can find out where they go to feed during the winter. Meanwhile, the islanders practise their dance steps for the annual May Ball.

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: James Martin presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: Food writer Nigella Lawson rustles up more of her favourite recipes, this time with the emphasis on cosy and comforting mood. For breakfast she makes a tray of dairy-free chai muffins, while there's a low-key lunch of Asian-flavoured short ribs - a perfect make-ahead, tender beef stew. Inspired by her visits to America's west coast, an informal supper for friends features Nigella's home-made, oven-baked fish tacos, which involve a bit of DIY at the table, followed by a salted chocolate tart for pudding.

programme.title: My Life on a Plate
programme.desc: Brian Turner accompanies Michael Buerk on a trip to his childhood home of Hereford, where his culinary memories range from the unpromising tinned spaghetti and overcooked cabbage served up by his grandmother to the wholesome food he found on his girlfriend's family table.

programme.title: Live Davis Cup Tennis
programme.sub-title: Tennis: Davis Cup Final: Belgium v Great Britain: Day Three
programme.desc: Belgium v Great Britain. Sue Barker presents coverage of the third and final day of the World Group's showpiece match, featuring the concluding singles rubbers at Flanders Expo in Ghent. The British team will have taken great confidence in reaching the final for the first time since 1978, but it remains to be seen whether the excellent form they displayed during three home fixtures played on a hard court surface will translate to the Belgian's preference of a clay surface. With commentary by Jonathan Overend, John Lloyd and Jamie Baker.

programme.title: Match of the Day Live
programme.sub-title: Football: Women's Euro 2017 Qualifiers: England v Bosnia and Herzegovina
programme.desc: England v Bosnia and Herzegovina (Kick-off 3.30pm). Coverage of the group seven match from Ashton Gate in Bristol, as England play their second match of the qualification process. Their previous outing took place in September, and saw them a record an emphatic 8-0 victory away to Estonia, with Danielle Carter scoring a hat-trick on her debut.

programme.title: Live Snooker: UK Championship
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine presents coverage of the closing stages of the afternoon session at the Barbican Centre in York, where the second round in the prestigious ranking tournament is set to continue. Eight more matches contested over the best of 11 frames were scheduled to take place, with the winners set to progress to the third round of the prestigious tournament, which gets under way tomorrow. The commentary team includes Dennis Taylor, Stephen Hendry, Steve Davis and John Parrott.

programme.title: Robert Peston Goes Shopping
programme.desc: The history of the retail trade in Britain concludes with a look at how the high street has been hit hard in recent times by the rise in online shopping and the financial crash. From Amazon to Zavvi, and the world's first pop-up mall in east London, Robert shows how the everyday shopping experience has changed and predicts how people will buy their goods in the future. Contributors include Amazon's UK MD Christopher North, ASOS boss Nick Robertson, and Sainsbury's chief Justin King. Last in the series.

programme.title: Ireland with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Part two of two. The second leg of Simon's journey begins at the Giant's Causeway, before visiting a kelp farm on Rathlin Island. He heads to the Dark Hedges in Co Antrim, one of the filming locations from Game of Thrones, and visits Belfast for the July 12 parades, discovering how the event has divided the city. He also learns more about Oliver Cromwell's influence on Ireland, attends the Gaze film festival, and meets monkeys at an animal sanctuary in the Wicklow mountains.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: The extraordinary changes that occurred in the 19th century, as advances in technology made gardens more lavish, but also more widely available. Monty pays a visit to Queen Victoria's royal retreat at Osborne and Derby's Arboretum, which was the country's first public park. He also investigates the scientific secrets behind the establishment of botanical gardens in Kew and Edinburgh.

programme.title: The Cider House Rules
programme.desc: An orphan grows up under the wing of the doctor running the home where he lives, and helps him deliver babies to unmarried mothers and perform abortions. However, he is eager to see more of life and joins a pilot and his girlfriend on the road - but unforeseen events present him with a host of difficult personal and moral decisions. Drama, starring Michael Caine in an Oscar-winning role, with Tobey Maguire, Charlize Theron and Paul Rudd.

programme.title: Snooker: UK Championship
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine introduces highlights of the evening session from the Barbican Centre in York, where the second round in the prestigious ranking tournament was set to conclude, with eight matches scheduled to take place over the best of 11 frames. With commentary from the likes of Steve Davis, John Virgo and Willie Thorne.

programme.title: Snooker: UK Championship Extra
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine presents extended highlights from today's matches at the Barbican Centre in York, where the second round was set to reach a climax. The commentary team includes Stephen Hendry, John Parrott and Dennis Taylor.

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: The shows comes from Dorset, where Ellie Harrison meets the members of a very special countrymen's club and goes looking for kingfishers at an urban bird reserve in Weymouth. Matt Baker visits a woodland architecture school, where local trees are used as building materials, Jules Hudson drops in to a historic family butcher's, Adam Henson takes stock on the farm, and Tom Heap weighs up the pros and cons of dredging Britain's ports.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Ollie refuses to be belittled by the formidable Jac Naylor as she makes her return to Darwin. Meanwhile, Morven clings to her professionality when faced with an elderly couple's emotional case, and Dom feels conflicted as he begins to develop feelings for a patient.

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman tries to help a couple hoping to swap London life for a village community in Dorset, and learns about the Lulworth Estate rangers' conservation efforts.

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed
programme.desc: An undercover police team tries to put a stop to a cup-and-ball gaming scam that is taking visitors to the thoroughfare for a ride. Plus, cameras monitor events as a new Underground station is opened at the east end of the Street and an Olympic champion arrives for a bike race with a difference.

programme.title: Len and Ainsley's Big Food Adventure
programme.desc: Chef Ainsley Harriott and Strictly Come Dancing judge Len Goodman's road trip takes the pair to south London, where Len has his first taste of Portuguese and Japanese cuisine. Ainsley heads to the kitchen and cooks a mouth-watering Portuguese chicken inspired by the day's adventures. Last in the series.

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood examines recorded footage of a robber who turned a homemade weapon on two friends, and a gang of crooks targetting elderly victims in Kent.

programme.title: Thief Trackers
programme.desc: The police explain how they caught a rogue scrap metal dealer, and a stolen laptop is tracked on its curious journey around London's theatre district.

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and reports from correspondents around the country. Presented by Jo Coburn.

programme.title: Live Snooker: UK Championship
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine introduces coverage of round three from the Barbican Centre in York, as the tournament widely regarded as the second-most prestigious on the calendar continues. Stuart Bingham defeated fellow Englishman Joel Walker 6-5 at this stage last year, and would eventually reach the semi-finals, where he was beaten by Ronnie O'Sullivan. Bingham would gain revenge at the World Championship a few months later, however, defeating 'the Rocket' 13-9 in the quarter-finals. With commentary by Ken Doherty, Steve Davis and John Virgo.

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz, hosted by Jeremy Vine, in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing - It Takes Two
programme.desc: Zoe Ball hosts the weekday fanzine devoted to the ballroom dancing show and is joined by the latest couple to be voted out by the judges after last night's dance-off. Plus, backstage gossip and a look at the choreography from the weekend.

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton visits Islay, travelling from Finlaggan - where the famous ruler Somerled once held court - along the windswept coast, through its historic ports and villages to end on its highest mountain. Along the way he joins dedicated locals keeping the seafaring traditions of the island alive, discovers the secrets of Islay's illicit whisky distilling past and climbs Ben Vicar for a breathtaking view across the Hebrides.

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Host Victoria Coren Mitchell welcomes back another two teams as the second round concludes, with the Athenians taking on the Bookworms for the last place in the quarter-finals. They must use patience, lateral thinking and sheer inspiration to make connections between groups of four things that may appear at first not to be linked, with one set of clues consisting of The Cradle Will Rock, The Pilgrim's Progress, The New Statesman and The Mr Men.

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: The second round of the student quiz continues, with two more teams of four pitting their wits against one another as they attempt to secure a place in the quarter-finals. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions.

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: Food writer Nigella Lawson examines how different days require certain types of food, sharing her favourite menu to help get that balance right in the kitchen. She prepares a light salad of salmon, avocado, watercress and pumpkin seeds, and a chicken shawarma with an array of spices, sauces and flatbreads - a dish inspired by a spit-roasted Lebanese kebab that is perfect for feeding a crowd. Nigella also creates two sweet treats, a glossy liquorice and blackcurrant chocolate cake, and chocolate chip cookie dough pots served with ice-cream or creme fraiche.

programme.title: London Spy
programme.desc: Danny is confronted with a side of Alex's life that seems to undermine the very foundation of their relationship. As he wonders whether to give up his private investigation into his lover's gruesome death, he realises a vital clue has been overlooked, but the consequences of continuing to fight for justice are more terrible than he could possibly have imagined. Tom Rob Smith's thriller, starring Ben Whishaw, Edward Holcroft and Jim Broadbent, with Adrian Lester, Harriet Walter and Samantha Spiro.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan comperes an evening of stand-up at London's Hammersmith Apollo, treating the audience to his own brand of humour before introducing routines by comedy circuit stars Jason Byrne and Stewart Francis.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emily Maitlis.

programme.title: Snooker: UK Championship
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents highlights from the Barbican Centre, York, where the third round in the prestigious ranking tournament was set to begin, with eight matches taking place over the best of 11 frames. With commentators including Stephen Hendry, Ken Doherty and Willie Thorne.

programme.title: Snooker: UK Championship Extra
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine presents extended highlights from today's matches at the Barbican Centre in York, where the third round was set to get under way. With commentary by Steve Davis, John Parrott and Dennis Taylor.

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: The contestants are summoned to the V&A Museum of Childhood, where Lord Sugar instructs them to become party planners. The teams have two days to set up and host a children's party for some high-spending clients, giving them the challenge of keeping an eye on profits and dealing with demanding customers. For one team, a massive oversight threatens the success of the task, and one member risks spoiling the birthday girl's day by attempting to keep a tight rein on the budget. On the other team, the entrepreneurs' efforts miss the mark with a lacklustre assault course, a mix up over the birthday cake, and a blunder with the party gifts.

programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down
programme.desc: Judges Kate Malone and Keith Brymer Jones ask the remaining potters to make 10 identical long necked vases using the Raku technique. This Japanese method of decorating and firing dates back to the 16th century and requires the contestants to take their red hot vases straight out of the kiln and plunge them into a bin full of combustible materials. Sara Cox hosts.

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Matt Allwright reveals how forged documents are being used to smuggle illegal food and animal products into the UK. Plus, a bogus e-mail that cost a couple nearly £100,000.

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed
programme.desc: Staff at an Italian restaurant prepare for a visit from Hollywood star Al Pacino, while a trainee guide dog is on the street to take on its biggest challenge yet.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two teams are challenged to scour an antiques fair and pick up bargains to sell for profit at auction.

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo traces the early 20th-century roots of the Spanish Civil War, which divided his family and sent his father into exile. The former politician discovers a nation fractured at the time by social tensions and regional loyalties, which today offer a rich diversity of cultures to delight the tourist. After arriving in Majorca from Barcelona, Michael spoils himself enjoying spectacular scenic views aboard a 1912 vintage railway and a 1913 tram. He also gets trampled underfoot at the bottom of a Catalan 'people steeple' and learns to make the perfect paella. Last in the series.

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break.

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: The day's political news, interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country, presented by Andrew Neil.

programme.title: Live Snooker: UK Championship
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents coverage of round three from the Barbican Centre in York, as the tournament widely regarded as the second-most prestigious on the calendar continues. Today's action will see the concluding eight matches in this round take place, with games decided over the best of 11 frames. Eventual champion Ronnie O'Sullivan came through his tie with fellow Englishman Ben Woollaston 6-2 at this stage last year. The commentary team includes John Virgo, Willie Thorne and Ken Doherty.

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz, hosted by Jeremy Vine, in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing - It Takes Two
programme.desc: Zoe Ball hosts the weekday fanzine devoted to the ballroom dancing show. She is joined by the couple who avoided elimination in Sunday night's dance-off, and Karen Hardy gives her thoughts on the weekend's choreography.

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Eggheads Barry Simmons and Lisa Thiel embark on the cross-country treasure-hunting challenge around Lancashire, Yorkshire and Merseyside, joined by expert assistants Paul Laidlaw and Christina Trevanion.

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: It's the last week of the heats, and the first three chefs are set a task by Marcus, who wants them to fillet a whole plaice, steam a portion and serve it with a mushroom cream sauce, all in 20 minutes. The remaining three cooks are set a Skills Test by Monica, who asks them make the classic Crepe Suzette. Finally, the six contestants cook their Signature Dish. They have 75 minutes to perfectly execute their tried and tested recipe for Monica, Marcus and Gregg.

programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down
programme.desc: The five remaining potters are faced with their most technically demanding challenge when they have to make a decorative chandelier in bone china. For their Spot Test, steady hands are required when judges Kate Malone and Keith Brymer Jones assess their 'banding' skills, and for the Throw Down they have just 15 minutes on the wheel to make the largest closed sphere they can.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Ed Byrne, Sara Pascoe, James Acaster and Gary Delaney join regular panellists Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons to give their irreverent takes on the biggest stories to hit the headlines, through stand-up spots and improvised games. Chaired by Dara O Briain.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark.

programme.title: NFL Highlights
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents the best of the action from week 12 of the regular season, with matches including New York Jets v Miami Dolphins at MetLife Stadium and Denver Broncos v New England Patriots at Sports Authority Field at Mile High. Plus, Green Bay Packers v Chicago Bears at Lambeau Field.

programme.title: Snooker: UK Championship
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine introduces highlights from the Barbican Centre, York, where the third round in the ranking tournament was set to conclude, with eight matches taking place over the best of 11 frames. Commentators include Stephen Hendry, Steve Davis and Dennis Taylor.

programme.title: Snooker: UK Championship Extra
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents extended highlights from today's matches at the Barbican Centre in York, where the third round was set to conclude. With commentary from Willie Thorne, John Parrott and Ken Doherty.

programme.title: The Hunt
programme.desc: The challenges predators face finding and catching prey in a forest, where more than half the animal species on Earth live. However, it proves a tricky environment for predators, as vision is often blocked, escape routes are numerous, and the terrain makes travelling at speed almost impossible. The programme features footage of tigers using their surroundings to ambush deer and pine martens making tunnels in the snow, as well as examining the strategies adopted by sparrowhawks, jumping spiders, tarsiers, eagles and chimpanzees.

programme.title: Don't Panic - How to End Poverty in 15 Years
programme.desc: Professor Hans Rosling explores the target of eradicating worldwide poverty that the world has committed to this week. He looks at 'extreme poverty', which is defined as those living on less than $1.25 a day, and examines dramatic human stories from Africa and Asia, as well as data on recent global progress. Rosling uses holographic projection technology to create bubble graphs and income mountains in order to assess the world's ability to achieve the goal by 2030. He concludes by showing why it will be easier to put an end to poverty quickly, rather than slowly.

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore properties about to be auctioned, then talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings.

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed
programme.desc: Protesting taxi drivers bring traffic to a standstill, while cosmetic chain Lush prepare for the opening of their biggest store, and a secret shopper searches for fake handbags.

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: Clive Mason meets world-leading deaf chef Scott Garthwaite, who demonstrates seasonal recipes. Plus, a visit to the Derby Deaf Drama group as they rehearse for a pantomime and a round-up of news stories. With voiceover.

programme.title: Terry and Mason's Great Food Trip
programme.desc: Broadcaster Terry Wogan and London cabbie Mason McQueen visit Dorset and sample food from Dorchester, where they find out about some of the famous names associated with the town. They also dine at the courtroom of the hanging judge, Judge Jeffreys, and sample pie and chips at the old architect's office used by Thomas Hardy. Their pursuit for the best local food takes them to a garlic farm, a chocolate factory and a vicar who supplies the local cider.

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Coverage of Prime Minister's Questions from the House of Commons at 12.00, interspersed with discussions, interviews and reports from around the country. Presented by Andrew Neil and Jo Coburn.

programme.title: Live Snooker: UK Championship
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents coverage of the opening last-16 games from the Barbican Centre in York, as the tournament widely regarded as the second-most prestigious on the calendar continues. Today's action will see the first four matches in this round take place, with games decided over the best of 11 frames. Eventual champion Ronnie O'Sullivan recorded a scintillating 147 break during his 6-0 demolition of Matthew Selt at this stage in 2014. With a commentary team including John Parrott, Stephen Hendry and Steve Davis.

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz, hosted by Jeremy Vine, in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing - It Takes Two
programme.desc: Zoe Ball has the latest news and gossip from behind the scenes, while her former dancefloor partner Ian Waite joins her in the studio to examine how the couples are getting on in training for Saturday's show.

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: TV presenter and gardener Christine Walkden and radio personality Matthew Biggs, known for his appearances on BBC Radio 4's Gardeners' Question Time, hit the road. With the help of experts David Harper and James Braxton, they hunt for antiques in Bedfordshire and Northamptonshire before going to auction in Greenwich, London.

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: This week's final heat sees six more chefs enter the kitchen to compete for the last places in the quarter-final. Monica's skills test challenges three of them to prepare langoustines and serve them with a Marie Rose sauce, and Marcus's tests the other three on their ability to make a burger in 20 minutes. The chefs then have the chance to showcase their style, technical skill and flair with their signature dish, aiming to prove to the judges that they deserve to remain in the competition.

programme.title: This Is Tottenham
programme.desc: In the 30 years since the Broadwater Farm riots, Tottenham has seen the child abuse scandals of Baby P and Victoria Climbie, the shooting of Mark Duggan, and the summer 2011 riots. The constituent still faces challenges, many of which are dealt with by local MP David Lammy. This programme goes behind the scenes at his fortnightly advice surgery, which deals with thousands of problems a year, including the mysterious disappearance of a woman's son, an immigrant whose wife is dying of liver cancer, a 22-year-old who is not eligible for a student loan, and a young mum who is fighting for her son's life-saving operation.

programme.title: The Apprentice: You're Fired
programme.desc: Jack Dee meets the show's freshly rejected candidate, having failed to impress in this week's property selling task. Regular panellist Romesh Ranganathan is joined by Radio 1 presenter Greg James to discuss the chances of the remaining entrepreneurs competing for Lord Sugar's £250,000 investment.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.

programme.title: Snooker: UK Championship
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine presents highlights from the Barbican Centre, York, where the last-16 round in the ranking tournament was set to begin, with four matches taking place over the best of 11 frames. The commentary team includes Stephen Hendry, Willie Thorne and John Parrott.

programme.title: Snooker: UK Championship Extra
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad introduces extended highlights from today's matches at the Barbican Centre in York, where the last-16 round was set to get under way. With commentary from the likes of John Virgo, Steve Davis and Ken Doherty.

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: Clive Mason meets world-leading deaf chef Scott Garthwaite, who demonstrates seasonal recipes. Plus, a visit to the Derby Deaf Drama group as they rehearse for a pantomime and a round-up of news stories. With voiceover.

programme.title: Earth's Wildest Waters: The Big Fish
programme.desc: Ben Fogle takes the four remaining anglers to Canada for the semi-final, where the country's ecosystem is driven by fish migrations. The contestants must try to catch Pacific salmon in the seas surrounding Vancouver Island, bull trout in the glacier-fed Upper Pitt river and giant white sturgeon in the Fraser River before judge Matt Hayes and a local expert decides who goes through to next week's final.

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: Food writer Nigella Lawson demonstrates dishes that combine the comfort of the familiar with the excitement of the new, including fluffy oat pancakes drizzled with a raspberry and honey syrup. She offers a twist on a classic Caesar salad for a light lunch idea, and rustles up a Greek-inspired supper for friends including squid and orzo pasta, and a sweet and savoury version of a cheesecake. Nigella's simple rice bowl with ginger, radish and avocado celebrates a few choice ingredients and results in a dish that's uplifting to look at, as well as to eat.

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: This edition exposes the trade in fire blankets with fraudulent safety claims and the fake tattoo inks that could be lethal. Plus, suspects running counterfeit operations at home.

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed
programme.desc: The developers of an Oxford Street building want to get rid of the squatters that have taken over in protest, while a passenger is taken ill at a busy underground station.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: In Derby, antiques experts Jonathan Pratt and Nick Hall help two teams find interesting items to take to auction and make a profit. Presented by Tim Wonnacott.

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Six chefs compete in the second heat, with the skills tests challenging three of them to create an omelette Arnold Bennett, and the other three to produce two types of brandy snaps. All of the chefs then have the chance to impress with their signature dish, aiming to prove to Gregg Wallace, Marcus Wareing and Monica Galetti that they deserve a place in the quarter-finals.

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break.

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country. Presented by Andrew Neil and Jo Coburn.

programme.title: Live Snooker: UK Championship
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine presents coverage of the concluding last-16 games from the Barbican Centre in York, as the tournament widely regarded as the second-most prestigious on the calendar continues. Today's action will see the final four matches in this round take place, with games decided over the best of 11 frames. John Higgins was defeated 6-5 by Anthony McGill in an epic battle of two Scotsmen at this stage in 2014. McGill would fall to Ronnie O'Sullivan in the quarter-finals, however. With commentary by Dennis Taylor, Willie Thorne and John Virgo.

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz, hosted by Jeremy Vine, in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing - It Takes Two
programme.desc: Zoe Ball dishes the backstage gossip ahead of this weekend's show and there is a sneak peek at some of the costumes the celebs and their partners will be wearing, courtesy of designer Vicky Gill.

programme.title: Live Snooker: UK Championship
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents coverage of the concluding last-16 games from the Barbican Centre in York, as the tournament widely regarded as the second-most prestigious on the calendar continues. This evening's session sees the final two matches in this round take place, with games decided over the best of 11 frames. Graeme Dott caused arguably the biggest upset of the tournament at this stage last year, when he edged out number-one seed Neil Robertson 6-5 to book a quarter-final meeting with Stuart Bingham. With commentary from Steve Davis, Ken Doherty and John Virgo.

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The best six chefs from the week battle it out in the last of the quarter-finals. First the judges Monica Galetti and Marcus Wareing ask them to make a pastry dish of their own invention from 10 ingredients including peaches, champagne, pecan nuts and pudding rice. After a double elimination, the remaining four contestants have to cook two courses for food critics Charles Campion, Jay Rayner and William Sitwell, before finding out who is going through to the knockout week.

programme.title: The Last Kingdom
programme.desc: The Danish invasion sees Uhtred driven to hiding in the marshlands with Alfred. With Wessex lost and the life of the king's child hanging in the balance, a bond is finally struck between the pagan warrior and the pious ruler, and they realise they must work together if their land is to be reclaimed. Alexander Dreymon stars in the epic medieval drama charting the battle between Vikings and Saxons, based on the book by Bernard Cornwell, with David Dawson, Ian Hart, Charlie Murphy, Adrian Bower and Sean Gilder.

programme.title: Russell Howard's Good News
programme.desc: Russell Howard offers his personal perspective on stories dominating the media, whether on TV, online or in print. The comedian also picks up on overlooked items that raise a smile and chats to someone involved in the news this week.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.

programme.title: Snooker: UK Championship
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad introduces highlights from the Barbican Centre, York, where the last-16 round in the ranking tournament was set to conclude, with four matches taking place over the best of 11 frames. Commentators include Stephen Hendry, John Parrott and Willie Thorne.

programme.title: Snooker: UK Championship Extra
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine presents extended highlights from today's matches at the Barbican Centre in York, where the last-16 round was set to reach a conclusion. The commentary team includes Steve Davis, John Virgo and John Parrott.

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Richard Bilton reports on corruption in one of Britain's biggest companies, uncovering evidence that employees bribed civil servants and politicians across Africa -undermining a United Nations campaign to save lives in the process. He challenges the officials who allegedly took the cash and asks whether the company will now be prosecuted.

programme.title: Dominic Sandbrook: Let Us Entertain You
programme.desc: Dominic Sandbrook explores how British post-war culture demonstrates the same anxieties and preoccupations as Victorian Britain, particularly in terms of the state of the nation and the desire to export British values. Where Dickens was concerned with the impact of industrialisation on poor urban communities, post-war artists, writers and filmmakers are preoccupied with the impact of de-industrialisation and the lack of work for these communities. Similarly, the civilising mission of the Victorian period has now become translated into science fiction and fantasy, where values can be exported to an Empire of imagination.

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: The Doctor faces the greatest challenge of his many lives when he is trapped, alone, in a world unlike any he has ever seen. Pursued by a fearsome creature known only as 'the Veil', the Time Lord must attempt the impossible in one final test, and if he makes it through, the long-lost world of Gallifrey is waiting. Peter Capaldi takes centre-stage in what is effectively a one-man episode for the first half of this year's series finale.

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin explore houses in Croydon, Surrey and the Welsh village of Maerdy, and a former barber's shop in Sutton Coldfield, Birmingham.

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed
programme.desc: Oxford Circus trials the closure of the ticket office and photographer Andy Barnes hopes to get a good picture of former Corrie star Michelle Keegan when she visits House of Fraser.

programme.title: An Island Parish: Falklands
programme.desc: Documentary following life in the British overseas territory in the south Atlantic, where it is autumn and the Rev Richard Hines is preparing for Palm Sunday, which involves collecting enough tunnock grass to make 100 crosses by hand. Over on Saunders Island, the Pole-Evans family are preparing to send the sheep off to market, while the islanders are ready to celebrate the Queen's birthday with a parade and reception at Government House.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining Welsh chefs cook their four courses again for judges Oliver Peyton, Prue Leith and Matthew Fort, along with guest judge and long-serving WI member Rosemary Bishton. One chef will be chosen to represent Wales in the national finals, taking them a step closer to cooking at the banquet.

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country. Presented by Jo Coburn.

programme.title: Live Snooker: UK Championship
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine introduces coverage of the quarter-finals from the Barbican Centre in York, as the tournament widely regarded as the second-most prestigious on the calendar continues. This round was dominated by players from England and Scotland last year, with Hong Kong's Marco Fu the only non-Brit still in the tournament. Fu was defeated 6-4 by Stephen Maguire, who set up a semi-final clash with Judd Trump, while Stuart Bingham and Ronnie O'Sullivan beat Graeme Dott and Anthony McGill respectively in the other games. With commentary by John Parrott, Stephen Hendry and Steve Davis.

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing - It Takes Two
programme.desc: Zoe Ball presents backstage gossip and behind-the-scenes action ahead of Musicals Week, with discussion by celebrity superfans and a famous face providing the latest rehearsal news.

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites four contestants to take to the black chair in the general knowledge quiz, facing questions on specialist subjects the Second World War in Europe, Victorian era British feminist and social reformer Josephine Butler, freemasonry and American folk singer and activist Pete Seeger.

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.sub-title: MOTD Live: FA Cup 2nd Round: Salford City v Hartlepool United
programme.desc: Salford City v Hartlepool United (Kick-off 7.55pm). Dan Walker presents all the action from the game at Moor Lane. Northern Premier League side Salford - co-owned by five ex-Manchester United stars from the 'Class of '92' - will be looking to cause another upset, having already defeated Hartlepool's League Two rivals Notts County 2-0 in the first round. Former Watford and Sheffield United striker Danny Webber scored the opening goal in that game, before a sublime strike from Richie Allen wrapped up a famous victory.

programme.title: An Island Parish: Falklands
programme.desc: As the anniversary of the Battle of Mount Tumbledown arrives, the Reverend Richard Hines joins the scouts on a trek up to the summit where they intend to honour those soldiers who died during the fierce fighting of June 1982. They plan to lay a wreath and bury a momento. Meanwhile, the new governor Colin Roberts and his wife Camilla arrive on the island. Elsewhere, Lisa Lowe tends her herd of Ayrshire cows Willow, Ella and Molly, whose fresh milk is like gold dust to Lisa's eager customers in Stanley.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emily Maitlis.

programme.title: Artsnight
programme.desc: A look at how robots are taking over mainstream arts and culture, with the Scissor Sisters' front-woman and DJ co-presenting this episode alongside a real robot. Ana explores how robots are flexing their creative muscles - having her portrait done in a life-drawing class of sketching robots created by French artist Patrick Tresset, and talking to the electroacoustic musician Squarepusher about his recent collaboration with a robot band. She also meets New York-based cyborg artist Neil Harbisson and in anticipation of the release of the latest film from the Star Wars franchise, discovers how the Star Wars robots have been brought to life for the big screen.

programme.title: Snooker: UK Championship
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents highlights from the Barbican Centre, York, where the quarter-finals of the ranking tournament were set to take place, with four matches each over the best of 11 frames. With a commentary team including Dennis Taylor, Willie Thorne and John Virgo.

programme.title: The Salton Sea
programme.desc: A man recovering from his wife's murder pledges to save a troubled neighbour from continuing down a dangerous path to self-destruction, and finds himself drawn into an shady world of thugs, drug addicts and undercover cops. Crime thriller, starring Val Kilmer, Vincent D'Onofrio, Adam Goldberg, Luis Guzman, Doug Hutchison and Anthony LaPaglia.

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby chairs the debate from Birmingham, with a panel of politicians, business people, journalists and celebrities facing topical questions from the audience.

programme.title: The Last Impresario
programme.desc: A study of acclaimed theatre and film producer Michael White, who paved the way for stage and screen hits including A Chorus Line, Sleuth, Monty Python and the Holy Grail, and The Rocky Horror Show. Director Gracie Otto's film looks back on White's days in showbusiness as he starts to sell off his treasured collection of personal photographs and papers. Among the interviewees reflecting on White's career are director John Waters, and actors Naomi Watts and John Cleese.

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: NFL Highlights
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents the best of the action from week 12 of the regular season, with matches including New York Jets v Miami Dolphins at MetLife Stadium and Denver Broncos v New England Patriots at Sports Authority Field at Mile High. Plus, Green Bay Packers v Chicago Bears at Lambeau Field.

programme.title: The Amazing Mr Blunden
programme.desc: A widow and her two children are visited by a mysterious solicitor, who offers her a job as caretaker of a derelict mansion. The youngsters discover the house is haunted by two children and try to lay the ghosts to rest, ultimately using magic to travel back to when they died. Children's fantasy, starring Laurence Naismith, Lynne Frederick and Diana Dors.

programme.title: Beverly Hills Chihuahua
programme.desc: A pampered pet dog gets separated from her owner, and is left stranded in Mexico struggling to avoid a dognapper and a ferocious Doberman, who are after her diamond collar. Luckily, a courageous German shepherd is on hand to help her get back home. Comedy, starring Piper Perabo and Jamie Lee Curtis, with the voices of Drew Barrymore and Andy Garcia.

programme.title: Ronnie's Animal Crackers
programme.desc: Ronnie Corbett continues to reveal just how potty the British public are about their pets. He meets pet psychic Michelle, who claims she can help troubled animals by reading their minds, and puts her to the test with his own rescue dog Baz. Also, wheelchair user Demi introduces her disability assistance Labrador Demi, and retired couple Sue and Bryn arrange a lavish family wedding - for their Norfolk terrier dogs Darcy and Todd.

programme.title: Ronnie's Animal Crackers
programme.desc: Ronnie Corbett finds out about the popularity of cross-breed dogs, meeting Jasper, a poodle who has fathered an astonishing 400 such designer puppies. Pigeon fancier Mark proudly shows off his favourite breeding male, worth £70,000 at its peak, and fashion model Tuuli gives her tomboyish whippet a makeover, ready for a fashion shoot with leading photographer Rankin. Ronnie also returns to the rescue centre from where he got his dog Baz, learning the sad truth about the thousands of animals that don't find a new home.

programme.title: The Wonder of Animals
programme.desc: Chris Packham delves beneath a snake's skin to discover what has made them some of the most successful predators on Earth, examining how their simple body plan hides remarkable adaptations that enable them to rival their limbed, winged and finned counterparts. The host reveals the variety of ways in which snakes use their bodies, and explores how they use their senses to hunt.

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The birth of wolf cubs is tinged with tragedy, a ferret makes a home movie, and it looks like the sea lions are about to have a baby boom. Kate Humble and Ben Fogle present.

programme.title: My Life on a Plate
programme.desc: Brian Turner discusses culinary memories with Anneka Rice, revisiting her childhood in Surrey, and creates two dishes that take her back to that time.

programme.title: Len and Ainsley's Big Food Adventure
programme.desc: Len Goodman continues to expand his palate in Birmingham, where he has his first taste of Polish food and samples some Thai fish curry. His companion Ainsley Harriott heads to the kitchen to cook a dish inspired by the day's travels.

programme.title: Len and Ainsley's Big Food Adventure
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott and Len Goodman visit east London, where the Strictly Come Dancing judge returns to his childhood sampling some Jewish delicacies and has his first taste of Vietnamese food. Chef Ainsley heads to the kitchen and cooks a mouth-watering dish inspired by the day's adventures.

programme.title: Saboteur
programme.desc: An American aircraft factory worker is wrongly suspected of sabotage when a munitions plant burns down, and he goes on the run - little realising a way of clearing his name is just around the corner. Alfred Hitchcock's thriller, co-written by Dorothy Parker, starring Robert Cummings, Priscilla Lane, Otto Kruger and Norman Lloyd.

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: The team shares tips on what makes a good modern collectible, and Philip Serrell and Charlie Ross visit the home of Aston Martin. Paul Martin presents.

programme.title: Live Snooker: UK Championship
programme.desc: Further coverage of the first semi-final from the Barbican Centre in York, as the tournament widely regarded as the second-most prestigious on the calendar continues. Ronnie O'Sullivan made it to his fifth UK final at the 2014 event, coming through a titanic battle with Stuart Bingham, who would gain his revenge in the World Championship quarter-finals a few months later. Judd Trump defeated Stephen Maguire 6-4 to progress to his second UK final, having won the title in 2011. With commentary from John Parrott, Dennis Taylor and John Virgo.

programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down
programme.desc: The five remaining potters are faced with their most technically demanding challenge when they have to make a decorative chandelier in bone china. For their Spot Test, steady hands are required when judges Kate Malone and Keith Brymer Jones assess their 'banding' skills, and for the Throw Down they have just 15 minutes on the wheel to make the largest closed sphere they can.

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: Mainwaring orders Wilson to bring the platoon back from a grudge match against the ARP wardens' darts team and get the men back on parade. The captain then takes a call warning of a suspected terrorist in Walmington-on-Sea and decides to deal with the situation himself. Comedy first broadcast in 1970, starring Arthur Lowe and John Le Mesurier.

programme.title: Live Snooker: UK Championship
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine introduces coverage of the second semi-final from the Barbican Centre in York, as the tournament widely regarded as the second-most prestigious on the calendar continues. Last year's semi-finals saw Ronnie O'Sullivan, Stuart Bingham, Judd Trump and Stephen Maguire battling it out for a place in the showpiece match. O'Sullivan narrowly defeated Bingham and Trump overcame Maguire to set up a mouthwatering clash between two of the sport's most charismatic characters. With commentary by Steve Davis, Ken Doherty and Stephen Hendry.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Noel Fielding of The Mighty Boosh and Australian comedian Colin Lane join Ross Noble and regular panellist Alan Davies. Host Stephen Fry asks a range of fiendish questions on the topic of kit and kaboodle, with points being awarded for interesting answers as well as correct ones.

programme.title: Glory
programme.desc: Fact-based historical drama chronicling the story of the first all-black regiment to fight in the American Civil War, and the inexperienced officer given the job of training the men and leading them into battle. Starring Matthew Broderick, Cary Elwes, Morgan Freeman and Denzel Washington, who received an Oscar for his performance.

credits.actor: Col Robert Gould Shaw - Matthew Broderick
Sgt Maj John Rawlins - Morgan Freeman
Capt Charles Fessenden Morse - Donovan Leitch
Henry Sturgis Russell - John David Cullum

programme.title: Come as You Are
programme.desc: Three friends who all have physical handicaps organise a holiday to Spain. They tell their families they are on a wine tasting tour, but their actual goal is to find a brothel that specialises in clients with disabilities and lose their virginity. Comedy drama, starring Tom Audenaert, Robrecht Vanden Thoren and Gilles De Schrijver. In Dutch, French, English and Spanish.

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: The A to Z of TV Gardening
programme.desc: Carol Kirkwood looks at subjects beginning with the letter F as she continues her alphabetical journey through the world of horticulture. Along the way, she gets inspiration and advice from some of the BBC's most popular gardening presenters.

programme.title: Big Dreams Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don meets a truck driver from Wakefield, West Yorkshire, who wants to create the perfect outside space for his girlfriend and burgeoning family, and heads to Swindon, Wiltshire, where a widow is looking for the best way to turn her bleak patch of green into an enticing cottage-style garden. Both have big ideas, but they're forced to tackle their projects during one of the wettest winters on record.

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: John Craven visits a seed bank in Shropshire, where the Woodland Trust is working to preserve Britain's endangered trees. Ellie Harrison meets artist Matt Sewell and learns how he captures the character of birds in his art. Adam Henson investigates a plan to paint cattle to make them more visible to drivers at night, and Tom Heap reports on plans to use insects as feed for farm animals.

programme.title: An Island Parish: Falklands
programme.desc: As the anniversary of the Battle of Mount Tumbledown arrives, the Reverend Richard Hines joins the scouts on a trek up to the summit where they intend to honour those soldiers who died during the fierce fighting of June 1982. They plan to lay a wreath and bury a momento. Meanwhile, the new governor Colin Roberts and his wife Camilla arrive on the island. Elsewhere, Lisa Lowe tends her herd of Ayrshire cows Willow, Ella and Molly, whose fresh milk is like gold dust to Lisa's eager customers in Stanley.

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: James Martin presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.

programme.title: Len and Ainsley's Big Food Adventure
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott and Len Goodman head to Bradford, where the Strictly Come Dancing judge has his first taste of a Pakistani curry and samples some Latvian cuisine.

programme.title: Terry and Mason's Great Food Trip
programme.desc: Terry Wogan and Mason McQueen continue their culinary journey around the nation, abandoning the cab for a punt along the River Cherwell in Oxford. Terry visits the city's old jail and they investigate the origins of the Oxford sausage and the famous old Oxford marmalade factory, before meeting students at the university who have formed a society to assess the scientific benefits of pizza.

programme.title: MOTD2 Extra
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents football discussion with the Match of the Day team, focusing on the headlines from yesterday and news ahead of today's fixture - Newcastle United v Liverpool.

programme.title: Live Snooker: UK Championship
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine introduces coverage of the opening session of the final from the Barbican Centre in York, as the tournament widely regarded as the second-most prestigious on the calendar continues. Ronnie O'Sullivan met Judd Trump in the 2014 final, and the audience were treated to a match that lived up to the billing, with the Rocket eventually prevailing 10-9 to collect his fifth UK title and maintain his record of having never been beaten in the showpiece match. Commentators include John Parrott, John Virgo and Ken Doherty.

programme.title: Match of the Day: The FA Cup
programme.sub-title: Match of the Day: FA Cup Highlights: 2015/16 Second Round
programme.desc: Action from the weekend's second-round matches, as the remaining sides from League One, League Two and non-league football looked to make it to round three and potentially lucrative games against Premier League or Championship opposition. Standout ties in this round included Hartlepool United's trip to Salford City - part-owned by former Manchester United stars Gary and Phil Neville, Paul Scholes, Ryan Giggs and Nicky Butt. Elsewhere, 2008 winners Portsmouth met Accrington Stanley, and Rochdale played Bury in an all-League-One affair.

programme.title: Live Snooker: UK Championship
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine presents coverage of the concluding session of the final from the Barbican Centre in York, as the tournament widely regarded as the second-most prestigious on the calendar comes to an end. Ronnie O'Sullivan won the title last year but is not taking part this time around, having been advised by doctors not to compete on the professional tour until the debilitating insomnia he has been suffering from improves. With a commentary team including Dennis Taylor, Stephen Hendry and Steve Davis. Subsequent programmes are subject to change.

programme.title: Brooklyn's Finest
programme.desc: Three Brooklyn police officers find their careers converge at a single moment. A veteran on the brink of retirement is presented with a difficult dilemma, a corrupt cop is willing to do whatever it takes to provide for his family and an undercover officer has grown disillusioned with his role and is ready to step down. Crime thriller, starring Richard Gere, Don Cheadle, Ethan Hawke, Wesley Snipes and Vincent D'Onofrio.

credits.actor: Det Ronny Rosario - Brian F O'Byrne

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: John Craven visits a seed bank in Shropshire, where the Woodland Trust is working to preserve Britain's endangered trees. Ellie Harrison meets artist Matt Sewell and learns how he captures the character of birds in his art. Adam Henson investigates a plan to paint cattle to make them more visible to drivers at night, and Tom Heap reports on plans to use insects as feed for farm animals.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Arthur and Morven struggle to rekindle their friendship after clashing over patient care, while Dom is distracted by a patient that he has fallen for and struggles to concentrate on the case of a nun who has lost her voice. Meanwhile, Zosia's confidence that she can impress Jac takes a knock when she sees a question mark against her name on a board in Jac's office.

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Matt Allwright investigates the fake clothing banks that are fleecing kind-hearted people. Plus, the counterfeit identity cards that could lead to a construction site catastrophe, and the fake steam mop that could give its users a real shock.

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed
programme.desc: A policeman has a shift to remember as he takes on dangerous cars, drunks and rooftop intruders, and the secret world of bicycle couriers is examined. Last in the series.

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: The show's antiques experts consider the various factors involving in restoring an item, while presenter Paul Martin visits Gwydir Castle, Conwy, to view a large-scale restoration project.

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood looks at filmed evidence used by the police, businesses and the public to catch criminals. Features a man and his dog as they face a gang of thieves and a shop keeper confronted by a man with a knife.

programme.title: Thief Trackers
programme.desc: Two bicycles stolen in London are traced to the East End using tracking technology, where one seems to have been sold to an innocent member of the public. Plus, a Sunderland mother helps in the conviction of the vendor who sold her a stolen smartphone for £300.

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and reports from correspondents around the country. Presented by Jo Coburn.

programme.title: Cash in the Attic
programme.desc: Angela Rippon and Paul Hayes visit Sheffield to help the Days, who hope to raise £2,000 to replace the windows of their home.

programme.title: Pressure Pad
programme.desc: General knowledge quiz, hosted by John Barrowman, in which two teams of five players are pitted against each other inside an illuminated arena, known as the Pressure Pad. The team with the most players remaining for the final round will put itself in the strongest position to win the £2,000 jackpot on offer.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Twelve contestants begin the battle to be named Britain's best amateur baker, facing tasks devised by judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood, who have created 30 new tasks to test their baking skills and creativity. Their first signature challenge is to make a Madeira cake, before they attempt to bake a frosted walnut cake in the technical. Day two of the contest sees the contestants going all out to try and impress the judges with their first showstopper, the Black Forest gateau. Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins present.

programme.title: The Great Antiques Map of Britain
programme.desc: Tim Wonnacott embarks on a nationwide journey to discover the people, places, antiquities and collectibles that reveal more about the human, industrial and social histories of Britain. He begins by heading to Bristol's Harbour Festival to meet locals whose antiques can help tell the story of this historic city, with items including the Lord Mayor's ancient ceremonial sword, a rare Douglas motorcycle, and pieces of Bristol blue glass.

programme.title: The World's Most Photographed
programme.desc: An exploration of how photography has been used and manipulated to construct the public personae of 10 major figures from history, beginning with the undisputed king of rock 'n' roll Elvis Presley. At the peak of his career, the singer's image was more carefully packaged than any other star before him, but Alfred Wertheimer talks about the series of spontaneous, unposed pictures he took of him as an unknown singer in New York, and a number of other photographers, including James Reid and Lew Allen, tell their own remarkable stories.

programme.title: Wogan: The Best Of
programme.desc: Broadcaster Terry Wogan takes a nostalgic look back at his self-titled chat show, featuring some of his favourite encounters with the biggest stars of the day. The first programme shows him in conversation with various Oscar winners, including Audrey Hepburn, Gregory Peck, James Stewart, Cher, Gene Hackman, Mel Brooks and Anne Bancroft.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
