programme.desc: Catherine Southon tries her best to guide an indecisive red team in Lewes, Sussex, while Thomas Plant leads the fun-loving blues. Tim Wonnacott finds time to explore the oriental features of the Prince Regent's Brighton Pavilion.

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz, hosted by Jeremy Vine, in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing - It Takes Two
programme.desc: Zoe Ball hosts the weekday fanzine devoted to the ballroom dancing show and is joined by the latest couple to be voted out by the judges after last night's dance-off. Plus, backstage gossip and a look at the choreography from the weekend.

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.sub-title: MOTD Live: FA Cup Third Round Draw
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents coverage from Cardiff City Stadium, as the Premier League and Championship teams enter the draw for the first time, and the 20 lower- and non-league teams to have progressed to this round look on in hope of being given a potentially lucrative tie.

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Host Victoria Coren Mitchell welcomes back two teams as the quarter-finals begin, with the Scientists taking on the String Section. They must use patience, lateral thinking and sheer inspiration to make connections between groups of four things that may at first appear not to be linked, with one set of clues consisting of Memoir: My Life, Song: Your Life, Film: September, and Novella: the Life of Ivan Denisovic.

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: The second round of the student quiz continues, with two more teams of four pitting their wits against one another as they attempt to secure a place in the quarter-finals. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions.

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: Food writer Nigella Lawson shares the origins of some of her ideas, revealing just how and why they came into being, including a bowl of steamed clams with Thai basil inspired by a recent holiday in Thailand. Her toasty olive oil granola was born out of a need to have a satisfying breakfast at the ready, while hunger pangs at the other end of the day led to a dish of griddled halloumi with a sweet chilli sauce. Finally, Nigella's friends are treated to a supper of griddled bavette steak, followed by a lemon pavlova. Last in the series.

programme.title: London Spy
programme.desc: After leading its everyman protagonist through the tangled and shady worlds of the intelligence community and the corridors of power in Westminster, screenwriter Tom Rob Smith's espionage thriller reaches a gripping conclusion. Danny finally discovers the shocking truth about what happened to his MI6 agent lover Alex, and finds what really took place that night in the attic before he found the decomposing body locked in a trunk. Starring Ben Whishaw and Jim Broadbent, with Adrian Lester and Harriet Walter. Last in the series.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Katherine Ryan comperes an evening of stand-up at London's Hammersmith Apollo, treating the audience to her own brand of humour and introducing routines by comedy circuit stars Henning Wehn and James Acaster.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.

programme.title: Ireland with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Part two of two. The second leg of Simon's journey begins at the Giant's Causeway, before visiting a kelp farm on Rathlin Island. He heads to the Dark Hedges in Co Antrim, one of the filming locations from Game of Thrones, and visits Belfast for the July 12 parades, discovering how the event has divided the city. He also learns more about Oliver Cromwell's influence on Ireland, attends the Gaze film festival, and meets monkeys at an animal sanctuary in the Wicklow mountains.

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: The stakes are raised as Lord Sugar summons the eight remaining candidates to Southbank Tower and gives them the task of acting as estate agents. The entrepreneurs have two days to sell mid-range and high-end properties to London's most discerning buyers, with the team that makes the most sales and commission winning the task. One team uses their charm to win over clients, while the other fails to strike a big deal with their over-familiar approach. For some candidates, capitalising on London's property market comes easily, but for others it is a nightmare as they finish empty-handed, having failed to secure any deals.

programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down
programme.desc: The six remaining potters are challenged to make a garden sculpture out of slabs of clay and with a place in the semi-final at stake, their designs prove to be more ambitious than ever before. For their Spot Test, the hopefuls transform a chimney pot into a strawberry container, before trying to impress the judges by throwing the widest plate they can.

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed
programme.desc: New series. PC Andy Pescott takes errant pedicab riders to court to try to stop their rule-bending, and the programme follows bus and tube drivers as they face their daily challenges.

programme.title: James Martin - Home Comforts at Christmas
programme.desc: New series. The chef demonstrates festive recipes, beginning by providing a host of clever tips and tricks to save time and stress on the big day. With guest Michael Parkinson.

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: Paul Martin looks at the history of Mosely Old Hall in Staffordshire as the team explores more antiques around the country.

programme.title: Ireland with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Two-part programme exploring the history of both the Republic of Ireland and Northern Ireland and examining the rich culture and troubled past. In the first episode, Simon arrives by ferry in Co Wexford and travels along the coast to Cork, joining the thousands who try to climb the sacred mountain of Croagh Patrick. He crosses the border to visit Crom Castle and Londonderry, before journeying to the northernmost point at Malin Head.

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break.

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country. Presented by Jo Coburn.

programme.title: Cash in the Attic
programme.desc: Lorne Spicer and David Harper travel to Buckinghamshire, where they meet Amanda Dobbs, who wants to raise £700 from her unwanted collectibles and antiques to buy playground equipment for the school in her village.

programme.title: Pressure Pad
programme.desc: General knowledge quiz, hosted by John Barrowman, in which two teams of five players are pitted against each other inside an illuminated arena, known as the Pressure Pad. The team with the most players remaining for the final round will put itself in the strongest position to win the £2,000 jackpot on offer.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: With the cake week completed, and one of their number already eliminated from the competition, the 11 remaining home bakers must now prove their skill at making biscuits, a task that can be deceptively difficult, and one that has undone many a confident Bake Off contestant in the past. The opening signature challenge this week is to create 24 biscotti, Italian delicacies that must be baked twice to deliver the perfect crisp crunch. Next is Paul Hollywood's technical challenge, in which the contestants tackle Arlettes - labour-intensive, puff pastry-based treats from southwest France. Finally, for the showstopper, the judges demand bespoke edible biscuit boxes, filled with 36 biscuits of different flavours. After all three rounds have concluded, it falls to Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins to announce which of the bakers will be asked to leave the tent.

programme.title: The Great Antiques Map of Britain
programme.desc: Tim Wonnacott is in Covent Garden, where he meets locals with treasures that tell the story of London's past. Items brought in include a snuffbox made from wood used in the original London Bridge, serving spoons created by a notorious Victorian forger, and a collection of embroidered First World War postcards. The presenter also finds out about the age-old pursuit of mudlarking on the shores of the Thames, climbs the Elizabeth Tower to hear Big Ben up close, and visits St Paul's Cathedral to see Wren's Great Model.

programme.title: The World's Most Photographed
programme.desc: An examination of the role played by the camera in enshrining the image of legendary actress Audrey Hepburn, renowned as an enigmatic fashion icon during the 1950s and 60s. The documentary also reveals pictures shedding light on a private and unfamiliar side - from the hardships and painful memories of her childhood, to her far-reaching role with Unicef.

programme.title: Wogan: The Best Of
programme.desc: Terry Wogan recalls some of his most curious and unexpected moments from his interviews, with clips including a cart-wheeling Nicolas Cage. Plus, interviews with George Best, David Icke, Macauley Culkin and Boris Becker, as well as one of Take That's first appearances on television.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: A father-and-daughter team takes on a pair of childhood friends in the antiques challenge at the East of England Showground in Peterborough with the help of experts Nick Hall and David Harper. Tim Wonnacott also visits a 13th-century house that has been owned by one family for 850 years.

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz, hosted by Jeremy Vine, in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing - It Takes Two
programme.desc: Zoe Ball hosts the weekday fanzine devoted to the ballroom dancing show. She is joined by the couple who avoided elimination in Sunday night's dance-off, and Karen Hardy gives her thoughts on the weekend's choreography.

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: The treasure-hunting challenge returns with a husband-and-wife battle as Downton Abbey star Phyllis Logan takes on Kevin McNally, who has featured in all four Pirates of the Caribbean movies. Travelling in classic cars and accompanied by antiques experts, the couple head through Kent towards an auction in Greenwich, south-east London. En route Phyllis visits the impressive collection of a controversial conservationist, while Kevin reveals just how much he knows about the universe.

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The 12 remaining chefs cook off against each other for the first time and have to create one outstanding dish of their own invention from a selection of meat, fish, fruit and vegetables. To test them even further, the judges have removed all the modern equipment from the kitchen, leaving the contestants to use only the basics of hobs and ovens. The four weakest chefs must return to battle it out for the final two places in the next round and face the challenge of producing a dish using unused ingredients from the previous test.

programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down
programme.desc: The four remaining potters compete in the final with Kate Malone and Keith Brymer Jones presenting them with their most technically demanding challenge in the Main Make when they have to make an original 12 piece tea set out of porcelain. For their Spot Test, they must cut intricate and decorative designs into leather hard porcelain using a technique known as 'the devil's work', and for the Throw Down they have just 20 minutes to make three high-shouldered jugs - one of the hardest shapes to throw at the wheel. Last in the series.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy show, with Ed Byrne, Sara Pascoe, Ed Gamble and Nathan Caton joining regulars Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons to give their irreverent takes on the biggest stories to hit the headlines, through stand-up spots and improvised games. Chaired by Dara O Briain.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.

programme.title: NFL Highlights
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents the best of the action from week 13 of the regular season, with matches including New York Giants v New York Jets at MetLife Stadium, Minnesota Vikings v Seattle Seahawks at TCF Bank Stadium and New England Patriots v Philadelphia Eagles at Gillette Stadium.

programme.title: This Is Tottenham
programme.desc: In the 30 years since the Broadwater Farm riots, Tottenham has seen the child abuse scandals of Baby P and Victoria Climbie, the shooting of Mark Duggan, and the summer 2011 riots. The constituent still faces challenges, many of which are dealt with by local MP David Lammy. This programme goes behind the scenes at his fortnightly advice surgery, which deals with thousands of problems a year, including the mysterious disappearance of a woman's son, an immigrant whose wife is dying of liver cancer, a 22-year-old who is not eligible for a student loan, and a young mum who is fighting for her son's life-saving operation.

programme.title: The Hunt
programme.desc: Examining the hunting methods of aquatic predators. The vastness of oceans means that wildlife is scattered over a large area, and animals often have to travel great distances in search of food. Blue whales' great size proves useful in their search for krill, while frigate birds have developed a clever means of catching food without having to land on water. Also featuring footage of sharks, sea lions, spinner dolphins, albatross and sargassum fish.

programme.title: The Naked Choir with Gareth Malone
programme.desc: Gareth begins the search for Britain's most entertaining amateur singing group, who must perform a capella - without instruments or backing tracks. The first four groups sing to stay in the contest, as they aim to impress before a live audience and jury of a capella experts, who will have the final say on who goes through and who is eliminated. A London community choir, an Essex Gospel group, six Southampton students and a group of female barbershoppers from Portsmouth are those first into the spotlight.

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: A lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories, cooking and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: The Jeremy Kyle Show
programme.desc: The host invites guests to air their differences over family and relationship issues, and provides them with his own brand of no-nonsense advice.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby present celebrity chat and lifestyle features, including a look at the stories making the newspaper headlines and a recipe in the kitchen. Including Local Weather.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: The ladies put the world to rights once more, discussing everything from politics to parenting, and invite a celebrity guest to chat about what they are up to - or anything else that takes their fancy.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: 1000 Heartbeats
programme.desc: Vernon Kay hosts the quiz show in which contestants' pulses are monitored and they must complete seven rounds before their hearts beat 1,000 times to win £25,000 - meaning they will have to stay calm under pressure or risk losing the jackpot.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Chas phones for help and Cain and Aaron respond by trying to cover up what has just happened. Diane is rushed to hospital, and Andy and Robert are determined to get revenge on whoever was responsible. Carly lets April stay up late and helps her get medicine for her toothache. Nicola and Jimmy get back together, Sandy tries to cheer Ashley up, and Emma becomes convinced that Chas really did have a stalker.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: When Jason warns Eva that Gary is using her to get back at him, she accuses Grimshaw of paranoia. Meanwhile, Tracy is angry when Robert stays out all night, and how will Andy react when Steph reveals Jamie's blackmail?

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: Paul meets Cavalier King Charles spaniels Lady and Gemma, elderly sisters who have spent their lives in each other's company. It is hoped they will find a new home together - but then things take a turn for the worse when the vets realise they also need surgery on their ears. Will they get the retirement they deserve? Also arriving is emaciated mongrel Hector, who is desperately underweight, while Paul tries to cheer up Alaskan malamute Baloo, the home's longest-serving resident, by giving the depressed dog a change of scene.

programme.title: I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!
programme.desc: The highs and lows from the past 24 hours in the Australian jungle, where another group of celebrities have left the trappings of fame behind to face the rigours of tough daily challenges, cleaning out the dunny, surviving on rice and beans and the unwanted attentions of hostile wildlife. Ant and Dec reveal how they have been getting on and announce who is going to face the next Bushtucker Trial.

programme.title: UEFA Europa League Highlights
programme.desc: Mark Pougatch presents action from the fifth week of group fixtures in European football's second club competition, including Liverpool v Bordeaux in Group B and Qarabag v Tottenham Hotspur in Group J. Jurgen Klopp's Reds knew a win would send them through to the knockout stages, as did Spurs, who recorded a 3-1 victory over their Azerbaijani opponents in the reverse fixture in September. Plus, highlights of Celtic v Ajax in Group A.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: As Tracey awaits the results of her scan, she and Sharon swap home truths in the comfort of a spa, and try to make plans for the future, while Dorien prepares to say a long goodbye to her daughter Naomi. Second of a two-part episode of the comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph, with Frances Ruffelle and Michael Lumsden. Last in the series.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Diane regains consciousness, but the doctors give Doug some worrying news about her condition. David celebrates his birthday with Nikhil and Leyla, but is oblivious to the tension between them. Emma is questioned by the police and is shocked to learn that Chas meant to kill her. Lawrence tells Chrissie that Bernice will need their support, leaving Lachlan concerned about how this will affect the family.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: After asking Roy to put an inflatable Santa on his roof, Tyrone is furious when Hope's big surprise is spoiled. Meanwhile, Steph is upset by friends who have seen her naked photos, and Chesney is annoyed at Sinead's reluctance to take up the offer of a free trip to Portugal.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.sub-title: Gino's Italian Escape - Islands in the Sun: Southern Sardinia Celebrate the Sea
programme.desc: On Sardinia, chef Gino D'Acampo takes a fishing trip and learns how fishing in the deep blue waters runs a close run second in importance to farming on the island. He then visits the bustling capital city of Cagliari, where he is introduced to the unique textures that the locals use to enhance their fish dishes. After a whistle-stop shop at Europe's largest covered market, Gino makes his way to the magical ancient site of Nora, where he cooks a succulent tuna dish, prepared as the sun sets over the ruins.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Roy offers Tyrone money, guessing he may be struggling financially. Meanwhile, Leanne makes Steph see that Jamie is the one in the wrong over her nude photos, and Mary is stunned when Brendan casually mentions that he's married.

programme.title: I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!
programme.desc: Ant and Dec present all the highs and lows from the past 24 hours in the Australian jungle as the campmates struggle through another day of hardship in their bug-infested surroundings, all in an attempt to reach the final of the competition.

programme.title: Raw Deal
programme.desc: An FBI agent is discharged for insubordination after assaulting a suspect, and ends up reduced to being the sheriff of a backwater Southern town. He is later offered his old job back - on the condition he will infiltrate a gang of Chicago mobsters and bring their leader to justice for killing the son of the Bureau's chief. Action thriller, with Arnold Schwarzenegger, Sam Wanamaker, Kathryn Harrold, Ed Lauter and Darren McGavin.

programme.desc: Disney sitcom, starring Debby Ryan as a Texan girl working as a nanny in New York.

programme.sub-title: If It's Thursday, It Must Be Beverly
programme.desc: Jessica helps Sheriff Amos Tupper investigate the murder of his deputy's wife and discovers a few surprising facts about the bereaved husband along the way. Drama, starring Angela Lansbury and Tom Bosley.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Louisa faces off with love rival Carrie in a battle for Martin's affections, and romance is in the air for Aunt Joan, who gains an admirer in the form of Edward. Elsewhere, Al makes a surprise reappearance and PC Penhale celebrates his birthday. Martin Clunes stars, with Joe Absolom and Louise Delamere.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The peace and tranquility of a rural idyll is disturbed by yet another gruesome discovery on its doorstep. Barnaby and Troy investigate the bludgeoning of a wealthy landowner's wife with a cricket bat, only to find the corpses mounting up as their inquiries lead them along an unsavoury trail of blackmail, greed, deceit and revenge. Whodunit, starring John Nettles, Daniel Casey and Jane Wymark.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show, asking contestants Nadia Quigley Lewis, Gavin Bailey and Julia Heath to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win £50,000.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Actress Sally Phillips, musician Rick Wakeman, professional snowboarder Jenny Jones and impressionist Alistair McGowan pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser, as Bradley Walsh hosts another star-studded edition of the show. The celebrities must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: The X Factor
programme.desc: This year's live show phase continues, as the remaining would-be stars face the fifth round of pulse-quickening performances. Last weekend's double elimination saw Mason Noise leave the contest after dropping into the bottom three, and in Sunday's results show, Simon Cowell found himself without a single act left in the contest, as Anton Stephans lost out in a sing-off against Ché Chesterman. Tonight, Simon, Nick Grimshaw, Rita Ora and Cheryl Fernandez-Versini are once again on hand to appraise the remaining competitors' talents, and presenters Caroline Flack and Olly Murs offer the singers much-needed moral support on-stage. As always, tomorrow's show will see yet another of the acts eliminated following another tense sing-off.

programme.title: I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!
programme.desc: Ant and Dec present the celebrity challenge, revealing which of the celebrity contestants are struggling to adjust to camp life, and which of their more survival-minded rivals have started to find themselves becoming one with the Australian jungle.

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show
programme.desc: The host invites actor Idris Elba to take a seat on the sofa, ahead of his return to TV in December in Luther. In recent years, Elba has taken prominent roles in high-profile cinema releases such as Thor and Pacific Rim, but is once again teaming up with writer Neil Cross to bring the troubled East London detective back to the small screen. Also appearing on the show are Celebrity Juice host Keith Lemon, Hollywood actress Liv Tyler, and veteran broadcaster David Attenborough, whose latest natural history documentary The Hunt focuses on the animal kingdom's most effective predators.

programme.desc: Christ Tarrant is joined by Coronation Street star Simon Gregson and presenter Vanessa Feltz to try to outsmart members of the public at TV trivia to win £3,000. Hosted by Richard Bacon.

programme.title: The Mummy Returns
programme.desc: Married explorers Rick and Evelyn battle the newly resurrected mummy Imhotep and his ruthless partner, who have captured their son. The undead creature is heading for a confrontation with a legendary ancient warrior - with power over a magical army to be won. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Brendan Fraser, Rachel Weisz, John Hannah, Arnold Vosloo, Oded Fehr and Patricia Velasquez, with a brief appearance by Dwayne Johnson.

programme.title: Jekyll and Hyde
programme.desc: Robert discovers he has some distant relations, so he and Max travel to the remote village where they live in the hope they will be able to tell him more about the Jekyll curse. On their arrival, they discover several mysterious deaths have occurred recently and the locals believe a legendary demonic dog is responsible. Robert discovers an ancient book that seems to reveal a connection between his relatives and Tenebrae, and suspects they are dealing with a shape-shifter. Amelia Bullmore guest stars.

programme.desc: Caroline Flack and Olly Murs present the results of the viewers' votes, and reveal whether Ché Chesterman, Lauren Murray, Louisa Johnson, 4th Impact or Reggie & Bollie are guaranteed a place in next week's semi finals. The two lowest scoring acts will be asked to compete against each other in a sing-off to impress judges Simon Cowell, Cheryl Fernandez-Versini, Rita Ora and Nick Grimshaw, with the loser being eliminated from the contest.

In recent years, Elba has taken prominent roles in high-profile cinema releases such as Thor and Pacific Rim, but is once again teaming up with writer Neil Cross to bring the troubled East London detective back to the small screen. Also appearing on the show are Celebrity Juice host Keith Lemon, Hollywood actress Liv Tyler, and veteran broadcaster David Attenborough, whose latest natural history documentary The Hunt focuses on the animal kingdom's most effective predators.

programme.title: Benidorm
programme.desc: When hunky Jason Gallagher (former Brookside star Philip Olivier) turns up at the Solana looking for work, Mateo gives him short shrift, telling him there are no jobs available. However, when the barman skives off, the newcomer seizes the opportunity to stand in for him without permission, and quickly attracts a crowd with his cocktail-making skills. Manager Joyce is impressed and offers him a week's trial, but Mateo is soon battling to reclaim the limelight. Meanwhile, Tiger leads Michael astray by persuading him to help steal the hotel's all-inclusive wristbands and sell them in town.

Chas is diagnosed with Post Traumatic Stress Disorder, but Diane thinks she is faking. Robert makes Aaron a deal, Paddy fears Rhona suspects something, and Bob checks out the competition.

programme.title: Sports Life Stories
programme.desc: A profile of the Sunderland footballer who made his Premier League debut for West Ham United aged 18, and has also represented Tottenham Hotspur and Portsmouth in the top flight. Throughout that time Defoe has had to overcome a series of personal tragedies, including the death of his half-brother in 2009 following an assault, as well as the loss of his father, who died while the striker was away on international duty preparing for Euro 2012 with the England squad. With contributions by Frank Lampard and Harry Redknapp.

Lachlan is furious and agrees to help Gabby break into Pollard's house, where he carries out his revenge. Rhona fears her past will threaten her chances of adoption, Paddy and Tess give in to temptation, and Priya returns to the family business with some surprising news for Rishi and Nikhil.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: A recent World Health Organisation report says that consuming just 50g of meat a day - around a slice and a half of bacon - can increase the risk of getting bowel cancer by 18 per cent. Fiona Foster looks into the statistics and asks just how safe meat really is. Postponed from 19th November.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Pollard discovers the robbery and boards himself up in the house, vowing that no one will touch Val's things ever again. Gabby threatens to tell the police that Lachlan is responsible. Jai plays it cool when confronted by his family, and Nikhil regrets taking his anger out on Leyla. Paddy tries to make amends for cheating on Rhona, Amelia and Dan try to cheer Kerry up, and Zak accepts Doug's apology.

programme.title: I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!
programme.desc: The contestants continue their third long week, although for one unlucky camper it's time to go home as Ant and Dec announce who will be next to return to a life of luxury. But before that, they present the usual round-up of action, including another Bushtucker Trial.

programme.title: Travel Guides
programme.desc: The tourists head to the resort of Playa de las Americas in Tenerife for an all-inclusive holiday. The Boyles from Dorset have never been on a package holiday, but initial excitement soon turns to dread when they encounter the hotel's British-style buffet restaurant, while Birmingham socialites Riah, Reena and Keisha go on a quest to find holiday romance. Pete and Linda can't understand why anyone would want to leave the hotel when there's free beer on tap, and the Brearleys test out the hotel's evening karaoke - much to the embarrassment of 14-year-old Ben. Johnny Vegas narrates.

programme.sub-title: Gino's Italian Escape - Islands in the Sun: Sicily: Sweet Food and World Wine
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo arrives in Palermo, the capital city of Sicily, and a place he has never visited before. Home of the Mafia, this portside city immediately stops the italian chef in his tracks with its vibrant street food culture and fascinating history, Gino has an unexpected encounter at the food market, meets a man who stood up to the mob, and tries wine tasting in Marsala. He ends his day in a nearby vineyard, cooking a succulant chicken in marsala sauce.

programme.title: Coronation Street

programme.desc: A lonely boy befriends an alien who has been left stranded on Earth. Steven Spielberg's sci-fi fantasy, starring Henry Thomas, Drew Barrymore, Dee Wallace and Peter Coyote.

programme.desc: Part one of two. Robert is tormented by the recent tragedies that have befallen him, causing him to lose control of his transformations. Bulstrode reveals that military intelligence is holding Ravi prisoner, but will release him in return for Robert's help in investigating a series of strange killings. Robert takes on the case, and joins forces a vigilante also on the murderer's trail - but when the truth behind the slaughter emerges, it leads to his new ally becoming a dangerous threat that Bulstrode wants eliminated.

programme.title: The X Factor

The presenters will be catching up with the contestants later in the week for a special follow-up show as they return to normal life after the hardships of the Bush. Last in the series.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples based in Manchester take part in the dinner party competition. First up are Raf and Kevin with their healthy menu - healthy minus the chocolate cake for dessert, that is. Their flamboyant apartment impresses Chantel and Stephen, but American Matthew seems less impressed. Day two sees Chantel and Stephen hosting a backyard party, while expectations are high on the final evening as food connoisseur Matthew and his wife Jane present an Asian-inspired menu.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer requires the help of his new friend, a former CIA agent, when he gets into a spot of bother with a Ukrainian terrorist. Meanwhile, Marge fantasises about being a contestant on a TV cookery contest, and the future of Ned and Mrs Krabappel's relationship is resolved. With the guest voice of Kiefer Sutherland.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Lisa worries yesterday's note is about her and tells Jade they need to leave. Meanwhile, Louis is spooked when he finds a second blackmail letter and Theresa turns up at the school gates in an attempt to win Zack back. Plus, Grace steals Darren's winning meal ticket and gatecrashes his dinner with Nancy, and Alfie and Peri have a heart-to-heart about family conflicts.

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.

programme.title: The Secret Life of
programme.sub-title: The Secret Life of 5 Year Olds
programme.desc: Cameras follow the youngsters' development after two weeks apart and time has made the heart grow fonder for Alfie and Emily, who are clearly happy to be back together. And although Alfie struggled to empathise with the rest of his peers before, a painting competition proves to be a turning point for him. George takes the children's rejection of his family recipe to heart, but goes on to triumph elsewhere, and romance is in the air when newcomer Sienna captures Arthur's heart.
programme.premiere: First showing on national terrestrial TV

programme.title: The World's Most Expensive Food
programme.desc: While most people buy their food in the supermarket, Britain's growing number of billionaires use a private network of luxury food suppliers. This documentary sees how they cater to their super-rich clients in a world untouched by austerity. They include a catering company who charge more than £1,000 per head and a Welsh cattle farmer who massages his Japanese Wagyu cows as well as giving them beer to drink (to improve the characteristic marbling effect in their beef). The documentary also meets etiquette expert William Hanson, who travels the world teaching super-rich foreign clients how to negotiate the minefield of a dinner party.

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Transsexual Charlie hopes to use his Irish charm to win the affections of 22-year-old Charlotte, who claims to have no gender boundaries. How will she feel when he tells her his secret? Retired market trader Billy (82) has his work cut out trying to tame divorced aromatherapist Sandra, and 20-year-old Rhys struggles to get a word in when he sits down for a date with chatty nanny Georgia.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The nation's favourite armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week. The programme captures their instant reactions and lively - sometimes emotional - discussions from the comfort of their own homes.

programme.title: Isis: The British Women Supporters Unveiled
programme.desc: Filmed during a 12-month undercover investigation, this programme reveals the British women glorifying jihadis and promoting an ideology that is supportive of Islamic State. Investigating their activities on social media and infiltrating their clandestine meetings, the undercover reporter discovers the identities of some of the leading female IS sympathisers in Britain who are urging Muslims to abandon democracy and travel to Syria to join Isis.

programme.title: Embarrassing Bodies
programme.desc: Dr Pixie McKenna meets a woman whose nipples are out of place following breast surgery, and Dr Dawn Harper examines a rare leg ulcer condition. The mobile clinic visits Scarborough, North Yorkshire, where Dr Christian Jessen encounters a man with an itchy problem, and firemen undergo testicular cancer examinations. A young woman also explains why size is not important in relationships.

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty investigates supermarkets' stringent criteria for the perfect vegetable, and the incredible lengths to which farmers go to grow produce that looks more attractive. In America, Kate Quiton examines why wine is getting stronger and learns about a machine that has been removing excess alcohol from some Californian wines since the 1990s. Matt Tebbutt takes on the ultimate tea-break challenge as he tries to settle an age-old dispute once and for all: which biscuit is best for dunking?

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: A look back at a selection of investigations from the Food Unwrapped casebook. Kate Quilton visits a cattle farm in America with supersized cows to feed the huge demand for beef, Jimmy Doherty discovers why pine nuts are so expensive, and Matt Tebbutt learns why shop-bought pies tend not to spill out their gravy - revealing that the answer grows on trees.

programme.title: Unreported World
programme.desc: This series lifting the lid on stories affecting people in less fashionable areas of the globe continues with reporter Marcel Theroux and his director Lottie Gammon visiting South Korea to investigate the growing scandal of modern-day slavery, involving many victims with learning disabilities who have worked for several years on a remote island chain. Theroux meets the victims as well as their family members who thought their loved ones had disappeared and died, and visits the places where the victims worked.

programme.title: Four Rooms
programme.desc: Anita Rani hosts as weatherman Michael Fish tries to sell a hurricane-inspired painting to either Gordon Watson, Celia Sawyer, David Sonnenthal or Alex Proud. Other items up for grabs include a vintage Dior necklace, a submarine torpedo table, some curious kinetic sculptures and a rare early edition poetry book by the Bronte sisters.

Also in the region, Phil Spencer helps Trudie and Steve and their two sons, who are relocating from Edinburgh to be nearer their relatives.

programme.title: The World's Most Famous Train
programme.desc: During its nine-month-long season, the Venice Simplon-Orient-Express makes over 60 journeys, covering 150,000 kilometres, with the majority of trips between London and Venice. The train is comprised of 17 unique 1920s carriages that have transported a host of elite individuals across Italy, Switzerland, and Turkey for more than a century. This documentary follows the stories of the staff and passengers as the train makes its way across Europe, with some customers having paid more than £2,000 for the privilege.

programme.title: The Murder Detectives
programme.desc: Documentary filmed over the course of 18 months following the police investigation into the murder of a 19-year-old Bristol student, weaving together the stories of a detective facing an apparently motiveless crime, a family desperate for justice and another who will do anything to save their son from a life behind bars. On March 5, 2014, Nicholas Robinson was attacked and made a 999 call before collapsing and dying from multiple stab wounds. So who would want to kill him, and why? Could a single black glove found at the crime scene provide the answer?

programme.title: Fargo
programme.sub-title: Did You Do This? No, You Did It!
programme.desc: Lou and Hank head to Fargo as they continue their investigation, the King of Breakfast visits Betsy and Molly, Floyd is summoned away from home and Bear questions the loyalty of one of his family. Black comedy drama, starring Patrick Wilson, Ted Danson and Jean Smart.

programme.title: The World's Most Expensive Food
programme.desc: While most people buy their food in the supermarket, Britain's growing number of billionaires use a private network of luxury food suppliers. This documentary sees how they cater to their super-rich clients in a world untouched by austerity. They include a catering company who charge more than £1,000 per head and a Welsh cattle farmer who massages his Japanese Wagyu cows as well as giving them beer to drink (to improve the characteristic marbling effect in their beef). The documentary also meets etiquette expert William Hanson, who travels the world teaching super-rich foreign clients how to negotiate the minefield of a dinner party.

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in to the River Rock Inn in Milford, Pennsylvania, where owner Ken Pisciotta is struggling to attract guests and battling huge debts. He has all but given up and his constant negativity is rubbing off on the staff. Can Gordon get this establishment back on track before Ken loses everything?

programme.title: The Undateables
programme.desc: The experiences of 35-year-old Tim, who has a mild learning disability and has wanted to marry for many years. When he meets Laura, 27, will he reveal he's already planned every detail of his wedding day? Essex boy Ali has achondroplasia, the most common form of dwarfism, and at 4ft 2, the 22-year-old is used to being the centre of attention on a night out, yet has never had a girlfriend. When he meets Kirsty, his nerves threaten to get the better of him and ruin the date. Finally, 27-year-old raver Alec has Saethre-Chotzen syndrome, a rare genetic condition characterised by the fusion of cranial features. Too nervous to approach girls himself, he turns to a dating agency for help and before long plans are made for him to meet research scientist Charlie.

programme.title: Of Horses and Men
programme.desc: Premiere. Five stories seen from the point of view of the characters' horses, including a man and a woman who are secretly in love with each other, a conflict over barbed wire, a mare that yearns to be free of its owner, a sailor tempted to swap his horse for vodka, and a man in search of God. Comedy drama, starring Ingvar Eggert Sigurdsson and Charlotte Boving. In Icelandic, Swedish and English.

programme.title: Four Rooms

Home upcycling expert Jay Blades reveals how a bookcase can be transformed into a doll's house or castle - a kid's Christmas present for next to nothing.

The Bristol detectives must start looking closer to home to see if they can gather evidence and find a motive before he hopefully returns.

Sharon tries to reach out to Rob, but after a brief reconciliation it turns into a major argument which sends the pair into a spiral of bad behaviour. For Sharon it's a night out with 'party pal' Kate, and for Rob it's the surprise decision to have a drink. Last in the series.

Anna meets the victims of such actions, talks to experts and confronts the perpetrators of these crimes, the effects of which can have devastating and life-changing consequences. As she digs deeper, she discovers a community of men who take pleasure from threatening and shaming women online and decides to place herself at the epicentre of the revenge porn phenomenon.

programme.sub-title: The Secret Life of 6 Year Olds

Kash and Elvin are keen to become group leader, but chaos ensues when the others cannot decide how to choose - by vote or by arm wrestle. Gentle Beatrice struggle to cope with defeat in a tug-of-war, asking her friends if they know the meaning of the word 'competitive', and there is romance in the playground as Elouisa declares her feelings for Kash during a game of kiss chase.

programme.desc: Mechanic Grant, 34, is rushed in after being crushed against a brick wall by his own car, which he was working on at the time. Doctors are concerned he has a serious pelvic injury and other internal wounds and work quickly to establish how severe they are. Meanwhile, 44-year-old Doug, who has a rare growth on his head and face which is prone to profuse bleeding, arrives in A&E, and 23-year-old cage fighter Charlie is treated in minor injuries for something in his eye.

programme.desc: More singletons meet up over a meal at the First Dates restaurant. Eccentric theology student Louisa is looking for someone to love her as she is. Will supermarket worker Will be the one for her? Legal secretary Anna is matched with male stripper Junior - although she has a different type of dance in mind - Italian locksmith Roberto meets Croation nanny Aleksandra, and Cameron and Louise look like the perfect match - but they've both been hurt in love and have their defences up.

programme.title: Liberty of London

In the first edition, yuletide-themed stock arrives in the middle of a heatwave and a wealthy customer reveals how he views the store as his local corner shop.

The programme highlights how these preachers are at the forefront of the country's fast-growing evangelical movement, which is gaining political as well as religious power. Last in the series.

programme.title: The Great Polar Bear Feast
programme.desc: Documentary charting the extraordinary gathering of polar bears that occurs every year in early September off the Arctic coast of Alaska. Up to 80 bears congregate on the frozen shores of Barter Island near the Inupiat village of Kaktovik, where they feast on the remains of hunter-harvested bowhead whales. Polar bears are typically intensely solitary creatures, so this behaviour is highly atypical, and has attracted the interest of photographers, scientists and wildlife enthusiasts alike. The programme also makes use of cutting-edge GPS tracking collars to trace the journey undertaken by two polar bear mothers, who must either risk contact with humans or make a perilous journey into the frozen north if they are to feed their young cubs.

programme.title: The World's Weirdest Weather
programme.desc: A look at icy waves in the Arctic and earthquakes in England. The programme also features vast floods, exploding rocks, weather on alien landscapes and lights that appear in the sky when seismic activity is taking place.

programme.desc: An air marshal on a transatlantic flight receives mysterious messages in which an anonymous terrorist threatens to kill one passenger every 20 minutes unless a ransom is paid. Action thriller, starring Liam Neeson, Julianne Moore and Lupita Nyong'o.

programme.desc: Dentist Amit Koshal hosts the second dinner party in Hertfordshire. He impresses his guests with an Indian-inspired menu, but admits his wife does not know he can cook - leaving his bid for the £1,000 prize in jeopardy.

Those in the running for the prize are Bonnie Camplin, Janice Kerbel, Nicole Wermers and London-based collective Assemble.

programme.title: Dispatches
programme.desc: The Government has promised to create 3,000,000 apprenticeships alongside its flagship plans for a new national living wage, but its own watchdog accuses some employers of wasting public funds and abusing the trust placed in them. Seyi Rhodes investigates whether high-profile companies are paying ultra-low wages while giving poor training, and uncovers a failure to tackle the real skills shortage.

programme.title: The Shopper's Guide to Saving Money
programme.desc: Kate Quilton flies to Florence to meet a person whose job is to conjure up new designer scents and looks at the ingredients that go into expensive perfumes - ask if they are really that different to the much cheaper scents in high-street stores. Dave Fishwick heads to Norway to investigate the cost of natural gas and questions if the big companies are giving consumers in the UK a fair deal. Last in the series.

programme.title: Hunting the Paedophiles: Inside the National Crime Agency
programme.desc: In 2013, the newly created National Crime Agency uncovered one of the biggest online child abuse cases ever seen in the UK, with hundreds of teenage boys having been duped into sending indecent images of themselves to what they thought were teenage girls online. Many were blackmailed into sending more and more pictures, with chilling threats made against them by an unknown abuser. This film documents the hunt to find the culprit, which would take investigators halfway across the world, and the race against time for social workers to try to locate and protect all the victims, the number of which keeps rising.

programme.title: Fargo
programme.desc: Hanzee gets busy searching for Peggy and Ed, while Dodd finds himself in unfamiliar territory. Noah Hawley's black comedy drama inspired by the Coen brothers' film of the same name, starring Kirsten Dunst, Jesse Plemons and Jeffrey Donovan.

programme.title: The World's Most Famous Train
programme.desc: During its nine-month-long season, the Venice Simplon-Orient-Express makes over 60 journeys, covering 150,000 kilometres, with the majority of trips between London and Venice. The train is comprised of 17 unique 1920s carriages that have transported a host of elite individuals across Italy, Switzerland, and Turkey for more than a century. This documentary follows the stories of the staff and passengers as the train makes its way across Europe, with some customers having paid more than £2,000 for the privilege.

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Supercar fanatic Eddie Kaen has spent millions on the design of the Keating in San Diego, California, but neglected to invest in things the guests really need. Gordon Ramsay's visit uncovers empty rooms, a failing restaurant and staff at the end of their tether - leading to a shocking crisis that nobody saw coming.

programme.title: The Undateables
programme.desc: Richard, 25, has Asperger's syndrome, which can make new social situations difficult for him. In this programme, he goes for a posh afternoon tea with Tammy at a five-star hotel. Two years ago, a motorcycle accident left Chris paralysed from the chest down. When he meets photographer Natalie, will his nerves get the better of him? Christina, who has Down's syndrome, is introduced to fellow singleton Matty. She's determined to find her future husband before she turns 30, but will Matty feel she's moving too fast?

programme.title: Play
programme.desc: Premiere. Five teenagers whose parents are African immigrants to Sweden use mind games to intimidate and steal from younger children without resorting to violence. The group manipulates the social attitudes of their victims, who are unwilling to defend themselves for fear of being seen as racist. Drama, starring Kevin Vaz and Sebastian Blyckert. In Swedish.

Following on from Secret Italy, her 2014 series of travelogues, Alex Polizzi delves further into her heritage by exploring the culture, cuisine and history of the country's most beautiful islands. She begins her tour with a visit to Sardinia, hearing the tales of kidnappings and bandits that have blighted the island's reputation in the past, finding out why there are more centenarians here than anywhere else and meeting a woman who claims to be the last in the world to weave precious sea silk.

programme.desc: Ben meets 40-year-old Amanda Owen from Huddersfield, who left behind a comfortable existence to pursue her lifelong dream of becoming a hill shepherdess. Despite having no background in farming, she now lives at a 2,000-acre farm in the Yorkshire Dales with husband Clive and their eight children. Ben is given a taste of life as a hill shepherd, learns the highs and lows of farming life and finds out how she copes looking after such a huge family as well as her 1,000 native Swaledale sheep.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Tony is infected with a deadly virus sent through the post by shadowy figures who demand the details of a long-closed case be made public in exchange for the antidote. McGee and Gibbs set out to identify the culprits and find a cure for the disease. Michael Weatherly and Mark Harmon star.

programme.title: The March Sisters at Christmas
programme.desc: Four sisters are shocked to learn their family home will have to be sold because of the the massive amount of repair work it needs. When their parents go away, the girls come up with a plan to restore the place themselves and have it back to its former glory by Christmas. Drama inspired by Louisa May Alcott's Little Women, starring Julie Marie Berman, Kaitlin Doubleday, Melissa Farman and Molly Kunz.

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Charlotte discovers someone is watching her every move, Alf struggles to give Roo and James his blessing, and John tells Marilyn the story of when they first got together.

programme.title: 5 News Tonight

programme.title: UK's Strongest Man 2015
programme.desc: Action from the semi-finals of the annual contest, which took place at Belfast's Titanic Quarter. Six athletes remained in each group after four were eliminated on day one, and those who were left took part in gruelling events including the truck pull, car roll, Bavarian deadlift and the final challenge of the day - the 'Titanic Load', lifting a series of progressively heavier weights onto platforms.

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: A special edition looking at the police dog teams in the Cleveland and Durham specialist operations unit. Cameras observe the highly trained animals and their handlers in training and in action as the documentary reveals the endearing bonds the hounds develop with their masters. Drawing on new stories as well as archive footage, this programme showcases the vital role the dog unit plays in collaring criminals within the region.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.sub-title: How Much Pain Can You Take?
programme.desc: The elusive Baitfish murders LaSalle's girlfriend Savannah in an effort to send a threatening message to Pride. A city-wide manhunt is triggered and the investigation threatens to push a vengeful LaSalle over the edge - as well as endanger undercover contact Sonja Perry. Scott Bakula and Lucas Black star.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the killing of photographer Martin Roe with the marines, who was due to testify at a court-martial after he captured a picture of what appeared to be a soldier killing an unarmed civilian. However, the photograph is leaked, and Roe is found dead with a needle in his arm.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Part two of two. Hetty and the NCIS team continue trying to find the elusive black book, but face competition from foreign security agencies keen to discover the secrets it contains - and Kensi is kidnapped as the search narrows.

programme.title: Britain's Biggest Bank Jobs
programme.desc: Documentary examining the nation's most memorable robberies, beginning with the events surrounding the Baker Street robbery in September 1971, when a gang of criminals broke into the vault of a branch of Lloyds bank and cleaned out the safety-deposit boxes. The programme examines how the culprits tunnelled under one of London's busiest streets for three months without detection and reveals how they came within inches of being caught.

programme.title: A&E: When Patients Attack
programme.desc: Documentary examining the rising number of incidents of violence and antisocial behaviour in hospitals, looking at measures implemented by Queen Elizabeth Hospital Birmingham. A sophisticated CCTV system and a private security force of 46 uniformed guards keep staff and patients feeling safe, dealing with everyone from drunks to people with dementia and opportunist thieves.

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: A pink mansion in Edinburgh gets a makeover from Ann Maurice and Alistair Appleton. They attempt to give the garishly painted home a more traditional Scottish feel by having it professionally redecorated and toning down the dark, oppressive wooden ceiling over the hallway.

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Ann Maurice and AlistairAppleton help a Portishead couple spruce up their bungalow to attract a quick sale. At £196,950, the price is right, but a few touches are needed to give the property 'kerb appeal'.

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Property expert Ann Maurice offers advice to a Perthshire woman whose split-level bungalow in Crieff has been on the market for five years. Ann thinks too much clutter is the problem, and quickly sets to work redecorating the hallway, kitchen and lounge, before moving on to the front garden to increase its 'kerb appeal'.

programme.title: Peppa Pig

programme.title: The Saturday Show
programme.desc: Matt Barbet and Gaby Roslin present the topical show with three celebrity guests, who discuss the week's headlines, as well as viral videos and the latest TV and film releases. Plus, a review of the newspapers, and advice and tips from experts.

programme.title: Annie Claus Is Coming to Town
programme.desc: Santa Claus's daughter goes to California in search of adventure, and falls in love with the owner of a traditional toy shop, whose old-fashioned business is struggling to make ends meet. However, a scheming elf tries to drive them apart to further his own ambitions of taking over Christmas. Fantasy, starring Maria Thayer and Sam Page.

programme.title: The Christmas Shepherd
programme.desc: A widow is devastated when the German shepherd that is her only companion runs away. The dog ends up at an animal sanctuary, and is adopted by the kindly owner and his daughter. When the original owner finally tracks it down, she faces a hard choice between remaining alone and separating the animal from its newfound happiness. Drama, starring Teri Polo, Martin Cummins and Jordyn Ashley Olson.

programme.title: Finding Mrs Claus
programme.desc: Premiere. Santa Claus' wife feels neglected by her husband, so leaves the North Pole for Las Vegas in search of excitement - and ends up trying to make a little girl's wish come true. When her repentant husband follows to try to make amends, he accidentally puts the whole of Christmas in jeopardy. Comedy, starring Mira Sorvino, Will Sasso and Laura Vandervoort.

programme.title: Christmas in Conway
programme.desc: A man with a reputation for being grumpy marks his wife's return from hospital with a present she will never forget - the Ferris wheel where he proposed to her - but his efforts to erect the structure in the garden cause problems with the neighbours and the law. Festive romantic drama, starring Andy Garcia and Mandy Moore.

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Special episode featuring footage of members of the unit coming under attack while trying to keep the bad guys off the streets, from axe-wielding criminals to thugs who are handy with their fists.

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Agents Delroy and Kevin face a web of deceit in an Italian delicatessen in South London as they chase a huge debt amounting to £29,000. Meanwhile, Steve and Paul must evict a tenant in North London who has not paid her rent for over 18 months, before heading to Cambridgeshire to make one of their most emotional evictions to date. Plus, Brian and Delroy track down a pensioner in Surrey who owes £15,000 for a business he bought four years ago.

programme.title: Football League Tonight
programme.desc: Kelly Cates and George Riley present extended highlights of the weekend's top matches in the Championship, League One and League Two, including Huddersfield Town v Middlesbrough, Queens Park Rangers v Leeds United, Barnsley v Sheffield United and Plymouth Argyle v Leyton Orient. Plus, a round-up of the main talking points, and interviews with a selection of players and managers.

programme.title: TV's 50 Greatest Magic Tricks
programme.desc: TV illusionists have been sawing ladies in half, catching bullets between their teeth, reading minds and performing feats of escapology for decades. Channel 5 counts down the best, including the astonishing set-pieces of Penn and Teller, the mind-bending of Derren Brown and the street magic of David Blaine. It features spectacular illusions, such as making the Statue of Liberty disappear, intimate card tricks and the lighter side of the business, thanks to the inclusion of comedy great Tommy Cooper. Paul Daniels and Dynamo also appear in this magic compendium, with contributions from Joe Pasquale, Dick and Dom, and Stephen Mulhern.

programme.title: The Gadget Show
programme.desc: Jon Bentley explores the latest technology for the home, from intelligent thermostats that save money to automated lighting to scare away burglars, while Jason Bradbury and Amy Williams have the aid of a special backpack when they go up against one of Europe's best adventure runners in a race across Cheddar Gorge. Ortis Deley discovers how a British company has worked out how to fully charge phone handsets in just five minutes, while Amy gets her hands on some new tech that claims to double data speeds and allow touchscreens to respond physically.

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.

programme.title: Sepp Blatter Exposed: The Fall of FIFA
programme.desc: Documentary examining the scandal that surrounds world football's governing body and its current president Sepp Blatter, looking at allegations of corruption that has seen FIFA become the target of a transatlantic investigation. The programme explores how Blatter became one of the most powerful men in the world, courted by presidents, prime ministers and corporations, but is now seen as a figure of fun.

programme.title: Gypsies on Benefits & Proud
programme.desc: Documentary examining the truth behind one of Britain's biggest issues - immigrants coming to the UK and living on benefits. As EU work restrictions are lifted, this film tracks a group of new arrivals from their Roma village to London, and members of Roma families already established in the UK talk about their experiences.

programme.title: Make It Big
programme.desc: As the halfway point of the project looms, Keren decides she's had enough of trouble-makers Jamie and Simon. A perplexed Chris can't get the accounts to add up and an attempt to tidy the office ends in disaster.

Romantic comedy drama, starring Jennifer Grey, Clark Gregg and Megan Park.

Drama, starring Candace Cameron Bure and Jeanne Neilson, with Christopher and Nicholas Shone doubling up as the youngster.

programme.desc: Premiere. Underwater princess Ariel becomes bored with her aquatic existence and spends her time spying on humans, much to the annoyance of her father. Disney's animated adventure, with the voices of Jodi Benson, Christopher Daniel Barnes and Rene Auberjonois.

Drama, directed by and starring Clint Eastwood. With Christopher Carley and Bee Vang.

programme.title: Dino Autopsy: T-Rex
programme.desc: Using cutting-edge special effects, this groundbreaking programme features the world's first full-size reconstruction of an anatomically complete Tyrannosaurus rex. The model is lifelike inside and out, giving a team of veterinary surgeons, anatomists and palaeontologists the chance to touch it, smell it and cut it open from head to toe. They will explore questions such as how did it feed with those tiny arms, was it cold- or warm-blooded like a mammal, and how it procreated.

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Agents Delroy and Kevin face a web of deceit in an Italian delicatessen in South London as they chase a huge debt amounting to £29,000. Meanwhile, Steve and Paul must evict a tenant in North London who has not paid her rent for over 18 months, before heading to Cambridgeshire to make one of their most emotional evictions to date. Plus, Brian and Delroy track down a pensioner in Surrey who owes £15,000 for a business he bought four years ago.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

programme.title: Secrets Of
programme.desc: Structural engineer Steve Burrows leads a team of scientists and historians to investigate the engineering involved in the construction of the amphitheatre in the centre of the city of Rome. Using cutting-edge 3D laser-scanning technology, they try to discover how the Romans produced some of the most impressive gladiatorial games seen in Europe, how the Colosseum's mysterious roof really worked and how the building performs in state-of-the-art computer testing against sports stadia of the 21st century.

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: This week, the doctors at Balham Park Surgery are faced with a series of surprises, including the victim of a road traffic accident, who staggers into the surgery intent on getting a doctor's letter for his solicitor. Meanwhile, Dr Heather Watson treats a man who has been bitten by a mysterious insect while camping, before finding out that her patient is experiencing agonising pain from his bowel movements. Plus, a routine ear examination takes an unexpected turn when Dr Chris Pearce's young patient reveals she has noticed blood in her stools.

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: In Bedfordshire, agents Paul and Steve try to evict a community of travellers who have set up home in a private car park, however they receive a hostile response and must react to prevent the situation from spiralling out of control. Elsewhere, Stewart and Elmore chase a debt of over £3,000 in Merseyside, and in East London, Paul and Steve attempt to evict a Romanian family who stopped paying rent seven months ago. Plus, Stuart and Vic try to recover £5,000 owed by a forklift truck company after an agreement went sour.

programme.title: Suspects
programme.desc: After an early release from prison due to cancer, Dean Price is beaten, stabbed and left for dead in a copycat crime, identical to the one he was convicted of having a part in eight years ago. The father of the original victim comes under suspicion, after reports of an argument between him and Dean and evidence of blood on Dean's kitchen floor. In an effort to get to the bottom of what happened, the east London detectives decide to reopen the original investigation. Crime drama, starring Fay Ripley, Damien Molony and Clare-Hope Ashitey.

programme.title: Capital One Cup Highlights
programme.desc: Kelly Cates presents action from tonight's remaining quarter-final tie, as Southampton welcomed Jurgen Klopp's Liverpool to St Mary's Stadium. The visitors' last piece of silverware was this trophy, which they claimed in 2012 with a penalty shootout victory over Cardiff City at Wembley. The Saints have never won this title, coming closest in 1979 when they reached the final, losing out to Brian Clough's all-conquering Nottingham Forest side.

programme.title: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis reveals how CCTV and technological advances are helping to ensure convictions, focusing on criminals in London involved in robberies, thefts, drug crimes, street brawls and weapons offences. In Soho, police officers monitor the activity of the area's 100,000 nightly visitors from a CCTV control room in an underground bunker, while in Lambeth the air support unit is called in when an armed gang are seen rampaging through the streets.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A woman is subjected to an attempted rape that bears the telltale signs of a sexual predator - but he was put behind bars in 2004. Crime drama, starring Mariska Hargitay and Dann Florek.

Ben is given a taste of life as a hill shepherd, learns the highs and lows of farming life and finds out how she copes looking after such a huge family as well as her 1,000 native Swaledale sheep.

The duo single out three suspects, but learn vital information has been stolen, and realise the whole Persian Gulf Fleet could be in danger.

programme.title: A Christmas Promise
programme.desc: An uptight city accountant and single father is hired to help a family save their struggling horse ranch before the bank shuts them down. His daughter isn't too happy about being stranded in the countryside over Christmas - but he thinks it could be just the thing to get their troubled relationship back on track - and as he searches for ways to save the family's legacy, he finds something else he never expected. Romantic drama, starring Patrick Muldoon, Charisma Carpenter and Mandalynn Carlson.

programme.title: 5 News Tonight

programme.title: Secrets of Great British Castles
programme.desc: Perched high on a volcanic crag overlooking the River Forth, Stirling has long been one of the most strategically important castles in Britain. Guarding the gateway to the Highlands, its battle-scarred walls have witnessed savagery and chivalry, intrigue, alchemy, adultery and murder. With the aid of location filming, aerial shots and dramatic reconstructions, Dan Jones examines the history of this stronghold and relates the stories of some of the powerful characters who have owned it over the centuries.

programme.title: Alex Polizzi's Italian Islands
programme.desc: Alex continues her tour with a visit to the smaller islands of southern Italy. She starts out on Capri, which, with its beauty, glamour and history, has been a celebrated holiday destination since Roman times. She enjoys its signature style, which she claims has never gone out of fashion. On Ischia, she scales the rocky heights of the medieval Aragonese Castle, before hopping across to the remote Aeolian island of Salina, where she samples the famous Malvasia wine. Finally she travels to Filicudi, an island that holds a special place in her heart.

programme.title: Ben Fogle: New Lives in the Wild UK
programme.desc: Ben Fogle meets Simon and Debbie, a former estate agent and lawyer respectively who swapped city life for a hidden-valley smallholding in the middle of Exmoor National Park. They now have more than 100 animals, some of which they keep for company, others which are destined for the table. However, their new life isn't an easy one. During his stay Ben learns how to rear, kill and cook 'extreme free-range' pigs, tries his hand at foraging in steep woodland and tries to clear an old woodland with a stubborn horse who is suffering from hay fever.

programme.title: At Christmas
programme.desc: The stories of people and families facing a difficult festive season, capturing the lives of those experiencing poverty, loneliness and the challenges of feeding a large family. The first film finds out what the festive season is like for those sleeping rough. They include 35-year-old Cathy, who became homeless after losing her job, and single mum Emily, who was moved into temporary accommodation but did not believe it was in any fit state for her two young children. Unless the council can find them alternative housing, the family face the prospect of Christmas on the streets.

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: A special edition looking at the police dog teams in the Cleveland and Durham specialist operations unit. Cameras observe the highly trained animals and their handlers in training and in action as the documentary reveals the endearing bonds the hounds develop with their masters. Drawing on new stories as well as archive footage, this programme showcases the vital role the dog unit plays in collaring criminals within the region.

Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Cote de Pablo.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: An intense storm brings record-breaking snowfall to the winter roads. Polar drivers Darrell and Toddattempt to complete their journey, while the rest of the team members fight to survive, stranded in the wilderness with no help in sight and no hope on the horizon. Meanwhile, despite freezing temperatures, the war between VP Express and Polar reaches boiling point after VP's repo mission is thwarted.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: In the wake of Batefish's death, Pride suspects a mole is among the ranks. When the team members learn of a security breach at the New Orleans cargo ports, they fear this might be the very thing Baitfish taunted them about just prior to his untimely demise. Pride contemplates whether the threat could be something to do with the Broussard Syndicate, the crime family that has been one step ahead of him all year, so authorises his unit to cover every angle conceivable to ensure the city's safety.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Director Vance charges DiNozzo with a special assignment to go to France, locate Admiral Kendall's wayward daughter Amanda and bring her home. Arriving in Marseille, Tony immediately heads to the local NCIS office, only to find five dead agents. After eventually tracking down Amanda, the pair embark on a rollercoaster ride to the relative safety of the nearest NCIS office in Spain. Michael Weatherly stars.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs travels to his home town after hearing news of his father's death, while the team investigates whether a fire on a US Navy ship was accidental or planned. The vessel served as prison to several members of the Brotherhood of Doubt terrorist group, whom Gibbs was responsible for catching. After the blaze, two of those members are missing. Tony argues that Gibbs would want to know, but Vance does not want him disturbed at this difficult time. Mark Harmon stars. Last in the series.

programme.title: Secrets of Great British Castles
programme.desc: Perched high on a volcanic crag overlooking the River Forth, Stirling has long been one of the most strategically important castles in Britain. Guarding the gateway to the Highlands, its battle-scarred walls have witnessed savagery and chivalry, intrigue, alchemy, adultery and murder. With the aid of location filming, aerial shots and dramatic reconstructions, Dan Jones examines the history of this stronghold and relates the stories of some of the powerful characters who have owned it over the centuries.

programme.title: Secrets Of
programme.desc: Structural engineer Steve Burrows leads a team of scientists and historians to investigate the engineering involved in the construction of the amphitheatre in the centre of the city of Rome. Using cutting-edge 3D laser-scanning technology, they try to discover how the Romans produced some of the most impressive gladiatorial games seen in Europe, how the Colosseum's mysterious roof really worked and how the building performs in state-of-the-art computer testing against sports stadia of the 21st century.

programme.title: House Doctor

Romantic drama, starring Patrick Muldoon, Charisma Carpenter and Mandalynn Carlson.

Romantic drama, with Haylie Duff and Antonio Cupo.

programme.desc: Lenny Daws v Ruben Nieto. Mark Pougatch presents coverage of the bout for the vacant European Super Lightweight title, which takes place at Westcroft Leisure Centre in Carshalton, Surrey. Daws is a veteran of 35 fights and has lost just three of those contests, but faces a tough task against the Spaniard, who has won 16 of his 17 matches to date. With commentary by Dave Farrar and Richie Woodall.

programme.title: Reservoir Dogs
programme.desc: Criminals are employed by a crime boss to carry out a diamond robbery that goes disastrously wrong. In the bloody aftermath of the heist, they try to establish what happened and how the police were aware of their plans all along - leading to the hardening suspicion that one of them betrayed the gang. Quentin Tarantino's thriller, starring Harvey Keitel, Tim Roth, Michael Madsen, Chris Penn and Steve Buscemi.

programme.title: Dino Autopsy: T-Rex
programme.desc: Using cutting-edge special effects, this groundbreaking programme features the world's first full-size reconstruction of an anatomically complete Tyrannosaurus rex. The model is lifelike inside and out, giving a team of veterinary surgeons, anatomists and palaeontologists the chance to touch it, smell it and cut it open from head to toe. They will explore questions such as how did it feed with those tiny arms, was it cold- or warm-blooded like a mammal, and how it procreated.

Family drama, starring Whoopi Goldberg, Nigel Hawthorne, Brian Mitchell and Victor Garber.

programme.title: Santa Who?
programme.desc: Santa Claus loses control of his sleigh in tricky weather conditions and crashes into a passing car - and the resulting bump on the head leads to a total loss of memory. It is left to a youngster to help him beat the amnesia and deliver presents around the world in time for Christmas morning. Family comedy, starring Leslie Nielsen, Max Morrow, Tommy Davidson, Stephen Eckholdt and Robyn Lively.

programme.title: Bruce Almighty
programme.desc: God tires of a down-on-his-luck reporter's constant complaining, so passes on His powers to give him a taste of ultimate responsibility. The newsman falls in love with his extraordinary abilities - but a never-ending stream of incoming prayers and his ambitious attempt to please everyone soon prove there is more to the job than meets the eye. Comedy, starring Jim Carrey, Jennifer Aniston and Morgan Freeman. Edited for language and sexual content.

programme.title: Bulletproof Monk
programme.desc: A mysterious Tibetan monk is entrusted with protecting an ancient and mystical scroll. As modern-day Nazis seek out the relic in a bid to resurrect the Third Reich, the monk searches for a suitable successor to take over his task - and a pickpocket is the unlikely choice. Martial arts thriller, starring Chow Yun-Fat, Seann William Scott, Jaime King, Victoria Smurfit and Karel Roden. Edited for violence.

He turns out to be everything she has always wanted in a man - but she soon realises her dream does not bring her happiness. Festive fantasy, starring Claire Coffee and Ryan McPartlin.
