programme.desc: A single mother struggling to make ends meet thinks her problems are solved when she wins the lottery, only to lose the ticket before she can claim the money. A greedy construction worker offers to help her get it back in exchange for a share of the winnings, only to fall for her while they search for it. Romantic drama, with Elizabeth Berkley and Jason Gray-Stanford.

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Long-running Australian soap charting the lives and loves of the residents of Ramsay Street.

programme.title: 5 News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the evening's headlines, including coverage of the latest national and international stories.

programme.title: The Gadget Show
programme.desc: The team presents a guide to the best gadgets for Christmas, with each taking a turn to host a part of the big day itself. Amy Williams invites friends to a sleepover, ready to give them the ultimate Christmas Day wake-up call, ply them with the ultimate in stocking-filler gadgets and help them get spruced up for the big day. Ortis Deley checks out the latest advances in present wrapping and puts up high-tech decorations, Jon Bentley uses technology to prepare the festive dinner, while Jason Bradbury is in charge of the entertainment. Last in the series.

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: Q's father joins the team to create more mischief, as the guys return to a fast food restaurant, pose as bouncers and offer phoney horoscope readings.

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The guys try to sell diamonds to unsuspecting couples ready to tie the knot, and pose as members of a very unwelcoming committee down at the boardwalk.

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.desc: Documentary looking at people relying on state welfare who aspire to glamorous lifestyles for their families. Kim in Portsmouth is desperate for her three children to take the beauty pageant world by storm and has spent thousands of pounds pursuing their dreams, but her partner Matt is juggling one obsession with another as he has an online gaming habit. Meanwhile, 32-year-old Emma in Cornwall has been entering pageants for the last three years, and is determined her benefits budget won't hold her back.

programme.title: Supersized
programme.desc: One-off programme focusing on young people who are obese, including 14-year-old Holly - who is twice her recommended BMI and has been offered a gastric band. Plus, Jess (15) is losing weight with the help of friends, while Harry is a YouTube star who is comfortable with his 16st weight.

programme.title: Britain's Craziest Christmas Lights
programme.desc: Former Slade frontman Noddy Holder narrates a documentary following four households as they turn their homes into electric winter wonderlands with extensive displays of festive illuminations. For these Christmas obsessives - who include Dave and Carol Edwards - putting up the lights involves a head for heights, DIY wiring skills and an unshakable resolve, with some inspired by the bling of Blackpool while others aim for the ambitious scale of a West End show.

programme.title: Ben Fogle: New Lives in the Wild UK
programme.desc: Ben Fogle meets Simon and Debbie, a former estate agent and lawyer respectively who swapped city life for a hidden-valley smallholding in the middle of Exmoor National Park. They now have more than 100 animals, some of which they keep for company, others which are destined for the table. However, their new life isn't an easy one. During his stay Ben learns how to rear, kill and cook 'extreme free-range' pigs, tries his hand at foraging in steep woodland and tries to clear an old woodland with a stubborn horse who is suffering from hay fever.

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.

programme.title: Loch Lomond: A Year in the Wild
programme.desc: The winter is mild and wet, which is good news for some but bad news for others at Loch Lomond and Trossachs National Park. Cameras follow red deer who are forced to higher ground, while salmon have gone six months without food. Meanwhile, mountain hares turn a conspicuous white to help them hide from predators, but with no snow they have become easy targets for hungry eagles. Last in the series.

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary.

programme.title: HouseBusters
programme.desc: Janet Ellis and the team suggest ways in which changes to homes could positively affect the lives of their owners.

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Ann Maurice and Alistair Appleton head for Hammersmith, west London, where a couple hoping to move to their dream home in Surrey are frustrated at not being able to sell their two-bedroom flat. A tour of the property reveals the problem is a combination of factors.

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Ann Maurice and Alistair Appleton help a Northamptonshire woman spruce up her country cottage in the village of Welton, hoping to entice a buyer to part with £250,000. An unsightly boiler and fireplace are discreetly hidden and the lacklustre decor is brightened up to lighten the ground floor.

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Property expert Ann Maurice tackles a three-bedroom terraced Victorian house in Norwich which, thanks to a vast array of deeply personal belongings, overpowering paintwork and too much furniture, has been languishing on the market for three months. A few coats of paint to neutralise the colour scheme, some effective storage ideas and a ruthless purge of useless items certainly impress the owner.

programme.title: The WotWots
programme.desc: SpottyWot draws a picture of what he believes a pony looks like, and when DottyWot visits the farm stable, she gets a chance to see the real thing. Narrated by Nicholas Parsons.

programme.title: Chloe's Closet
programme.desc: Chloe and her friends help a frazzled chef cook a special meal for the mayor and her husband.

programme.title: Lily's Driftwood Bay
programme.desc: Lily and Bull get very lost on a camping trip when they follow a little flying light.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Trevor steers the school bus into a bog, and winds up getting stuck in the mud himself.

programme.title: Wissper
programme.desc: Gertie the giraffe needs help bending down to take a drink, so Wissper enlists the help of Peggy the penguin to raise the water level.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa announces only girls are allowed to play in her treehouse, so Grandpa Pig builds the boys their own den.

programme.title: Pip Ahoy!
programme.desc: After seeing a photo of Skipper on a camping trip, Pip and Alba are inspired to do the same, so they set off for River Island - but find that Skipper's old tent is full of holes.

programme.title: Little Princess
programme.sub-title: Can I Have It Back Now, Please?
programme.desc: The heroine's baby cousin visits and is lent Little Princess's teddy for the day.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: The team is asked to build a bridge over the River Coil in time for the Spring City Quarter Marathon, but Scoop's fear of fish leaves Lofty in danger.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.desc: Gator and Percy try to reunite at Christmas, but they keep accidentally missing each other.

programme.title: Noddy in Toyland
programme.desc: The mermaids accidentally break the lighthouse's bulb and race to find another light before the pirate ship runs aground.

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: The elves give the King chickens so he can have eggs whenever he likes.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: George plays hide-and-seek with Peppa, but is not very good at it.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: George is excited to join Peppa and the gang at the playgroup.

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Ryder and the team must rescue a girl and her cat when they become stuck on the ski lift while enjoying a day trip on Jake's Mountain.

programme.title: Bananas in Pyjamas
programme.desc: The Bananas discover that doing things quickly is not always the best method as they try to get through their chores for Rat, Bernard, and the Teddies, as fast as possible.

programme.title: Toot the Tiny Tugboat
programme.desc: The tiny boat is happy to see a flock of geese has taken up residence in the harbour, but when everyone is woken at dawn by the birds' noisy honking, he tries to restore the peace.

programme.title: The Wright Stuff
programme.desc: Matthew Wright and guests talk about the issues of the day, with viewers calling in to offer their opinions.

programme.title: The Christmas Spirit
programme.desc: A reporter investigates a real estate development in her parents' small town, only to end up in a coma following a car crash. Her spirit leaves her body and discovers the businessman behind the scheme is in the same situation, so tries to change his mind. Fantasy, starring Nicollette Sheridan, Bart Johnson and Olympia Dukakis.

programme.title: 5 News Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Long-running Australian soap charting the lives and loves of the residents of Ramsay Street.

programme.title: All I Want for Christmas
programme.desc: An executive who has been criticised by her boss for not listening to others meets one of Santa's helpers and is granted an unusual gift - the power to read other people's thoughts. She puts her new talent to good use in trying to be a more sensitive person and develops a romance with an office rival. Festive drama, starring Melissa Sagemiller and Martin Klebba.

programme.title: A Bride for Christmas
programme.desc: A woman swears off serious relationships after breaking off her third failed engagement, only to run into a man who seems perfect for her a month before Christmas. However, she does not realise he has made a bet with his friends that he can persuade a woman to marry him before the holiday begins. Romantic drama, with Arielle Kebbel and Andrew W Walker.

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Long-running Australian soap charting the lives and loves of the residents of Ramsay Street.

programme.title: 5 News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the evening's headlines, including coverage of the latest national and international stories.

programme.title: Kids' Hospital at Christmas
programme.desc: Documentary following staff and patients at the Royal Manchester Children's Hospital over the festive season. In the first edition, 15-year-old Emily is allowed home for just two hours to decorate the family Christmas tree after having spent almost the entire year in hospital owing to a series of complications relating to a rare genetic condition called Ehlers-Danlos syndrome. Eight-year-old Hya suffered kidney failure at birth, but clotting factors mean that dialysis will not be an option for much longer, so doctors and her family have made the decision that she should have a transplant using a donor kidney from her mother, with Malcolm Lewis carrying out the operation.

programme.title: Crackers About Christmas
programme.desc: Eccentric people who are always in the festive holiday spirit, including a man who celebrates Christmas every day and whose daily routine includes posting himself cards, breakfasting on mince pies and sherry, wrapping and opening presents, dining with guests on roast turkey and watching the Queen's speech. Plus, a woman whose home is full of Christmas baubles, and a man who has set up his own school for Santas.

programme.title: Meet the Psychopaths
programme.desc: New series. Documentary exploring the nature of psychopaths, using cutting-edge science to reveal what makes them so different to others. Forensic psychiatrist Tony Maden shares his own specially commissioned personality profiles and assessments of psychopaths and the programme showcases the research being undertaken to understand the condition. The first edition features case studies of serial killers Joanna Dennehy and Dennis Nilsen, as well as convicted murderer John Cannan, while Maden also meets armed robber Noel 'Razor' Smith.

programme.title: CSI: Cyber
programme.desc: Following a teenager's death, the team tracks down a killer who hacks popular online games to convince vulnerable teenagers to deliver weapons purchased from the dark web. Patricia Arquette stars.

credits.actor: Special Agent Avery Ryan - Patricia Arquette
Elijah Mundo - James Van Der Beek

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Boyd Hartwell, a hedge fund manager away in Hong Kong on business, is forced to watch helplessly as a video call home is interrupted by an intruder, who proceeds to rape and kidnap his wife. A ransom is issued, demaning that Boyd offer up 250,000 dollars for the safe return of his spouse, but when the person collecting the money turns out to be the missing wife herself, Benson and the team realise there might be more to this case than they initially suspected. Crime drama, starring Mariska Hargitay.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The detectives try to track down a serial rapist, but have to contend with neighbourhood watch members who become vigilantes. Crime drama, starring Mariska Hargitay.

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: This week, the doctors at Balham Park Surgery are faced with a series of surprises, including the victim of a road traffic accident, who staggers into the surgery intent on getting a doctor's letter for his solicitor. Meanwhile, Dr Heather Watson treats a man who has been bitten by a mysterious insect while camping, before finding out that her patient is experiencing agonising pain from his bowel movements. Plus, a routine ear examination takes an unexpected turn when Dr Chris Pearce's young patient reveals she has noticed blood in her stools.

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of dedicated volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary.

programme.title: Divine Designs
programme.desc: Art historian Professor Paul Binski presents an examination of Britain's religious architecture and culture, focusing on the treasures of Winchester Cathedral, the Norman showpiece designed to rival the glories of St Peter's in Rome.

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Ann Maurice and Alistair Appleton head for Sandhurst, Berkshire, to offer advice to Julie Frith, the owner of a four-bedroom house that has remained unsold for a year, despite two reductions in the asking price. The first thing that strikes potential buyers is the property's unfinished feel.

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Interior designer Ann Maurice looks back over home improvement highlights from the series, and focuses on making the most of original features.

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Californian interior designer and estate agent Ann Maurice visits a house on the market, and offers advice on making it more attractive to would-be buyers.
